Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.





About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.




What You'll Do

Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.



Requirements


5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.



Benefits



Working pattern and location

40 hours per week, permanent contract¬†
Monday - Friday
Hybrid role




Benefits

Meal Vouchers (‚Ç¨7 per working day)
26 days holidays + national bank holidays¬†
Individual training paths
Opportunity to develop and move within the company
National and international mobility options¬†
Yearly team activities
Food canteen at the office




MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

  • Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
  • Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
  • Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.


Benefits

Working pattern and location

  • 40 hours per week, permanent contract 
  • Monday - Friday
  • Hybrid role


Benefits

  • Meal Vouchers (‚Ç¨7 per working day)
  • 26 days holidays + national bank holidays 
  • Individual training paths
  • Opportunity to develop and move within the company
  • National and international mobility options 
  • Yearly team activities
  • Food canteen at the office


MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Milan, IT

Octopus Energy Italia üáÆüáπ ‚Äì Data /

Full-time /

Hybrid



Benvenuti nel futuro dell‚Äôenergia!

La missione di Octopus Energy √® rendere l‚Äôenergia rinnovabile accessibile a tutti.

Grazie alla tecnologia, stiamo guidando la rivoluzione energetica a livello globale, offrendo energia pulita a prezzi convenienti e un servizio clienti sbalorditivo.

Se non ti piacciono le sfide non inviarci la tua candidatura ;)

In Octopus Energy non amiamo la burocrazia, le regole troppo stringenti e le offerte commerciali poco chiare.

Vogliamo rivoluzionare il mercato energetico italiano. Per farlo, siamo alla ricerca di persone motivate, che condividano i nostri stessi valori.

Se hai a cuore il futuro del nostro pianeta e vuoi aiutarci a migliorare il settore energetico, unisciti al nostro team!

Con la crescita vertiginosa che stiamo avendo in Octopus, √® emersa la straordinaria opportunit√† di fare la differenza andando a utilizzare in modo intelligente e creativo la grande mole di dati che ogni giorno gestiamo come compagnia energetica. Per fare questo abbiamo quindi deciso di aprire una posizione come Senior Data Scientist.

Cosa farai


Utilizzando le risorse disponibili (e.g. datalake), potrai aiutare i vari team sviluppare modelli/Dashboard/strategie Data driven
Produrrai analisi approfondite dei dati per estrarre insight utili e solidi utili al fine di prendere delle decisioni
Svilupperai la nostra suite di reportistica utilizzando gli strumenti di BI e uno stack tecnologico moderno
Consoliderai e integrerai l'architettura dati alla base dei futuri progetti di analisi
Identificherai proattivamente nuove aree di lavoro e opportunit√† di miglioramento
Comunicherai concetti complessi in modo efficace e con confidenza.
Svilupperai modelli di machine learning a supporto di decisioni complesse



Cosa ti serve


Propensione ad essere curiosi e a farsi domande
Almeno 6 anni di esperienza
Capacit√† di gestione delle priorit√† in un ambiente in rapida crescita
Buona padronanza di alcuni concetti base dell‚Äôambito finance e contabilit√† (attivit√† di rendicontazione, stato patrimoniale, conto economico e simili)
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese
Esperienza pregressa di Python
Conoscenza dei test e delle tecniche statistiche
Buona conoscenza di SQL
Capacit√† di costruire processi ETL e/o di mantenere un Data Lake
Conoscenza del workflow dbt √® considerata un plus



Cos'altro ti piacer√† di noi


Octopus Energy rappresenta una cultura unica: un'organizzazione in cui le persone imparano, prendono decisioni e costruiscono pi√π rapidamente. Dove le persone lavorano con autonomia, accanto a una vasta gamma di co-proprietari straordinari, su progetti che rompono schemi. Vogliamo che il tuo duro lavoro venga premiato con vantaggi che ti interessano davvero!
Ambiente di lavoro flessibile - c'√® un reale equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale qui, ti trattiamo come un essere umano e facciamo del nostro meglio per far convergere il lavoro e la vita in modo armonioso.
Equity Options Scheme - possiedi la tua parte dell'azienda, opzioni di azioni nell'intero Octopus Energy Group: tutti lavoriamo insieme per il successo.
Cultura dell'ufficio - Ogni settimana, il venerd√¨, ci riuniamo tutti (questo avviene anche virtualmente) per gli aggiornamenti aziendali e un brindisi - lo chiamiamo Family Dinner.
Il tuo sviluppo √® importante - supportiamo e aiutiamo con lo sviluppo, inclusi corsi interni ed esterni, apprendimento, supporto allo studio, ecc., tutto su misura per te.

Title: Clinical Research Scientist Chase
Description:
Job Description: CNS Clinical Project Manager

Position: Clinical Project Manager ‚Äì CNS

Location: Milan, Italy

Employment Type: Full-Time

Industry: Biotechnology

Company Overview

Join a well-established and fully funded biotech company at the forefront of central nervous system (CNS) therapeutics. With an innovative pipeline targeting unmet medical needs in neurology and psychiatry, we are expanding our clinical operations team and are seeking a dedicated Clinical Project Manager (CPM) to oversee and drive our CNS clinical trials to success.

Key Responsibilities


Clinical Trial Oversight:
Plan, execute, and manage all phases of CNS clinical trials, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and budget.
Oversee multiple trials simultaneously across international sites, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
Team Leadership:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including regulatory, data management, medical affairs, and external vendors.
Act as the primary point of contact between sponsors, investigators, and site staff to ensure effective communication.
Regulatory & Compliance:
Ensure all trials adhere to ICH-GCP guidelines, company SOPs, and relevant regulatory requirements.
Prepare and review essential regulatory documents and submissions to ethics committees and authorities.
Budget & Resource Management:
Develop, track, and manage clinical trial budgets, contracts, and resources.
Optimize resources to meet trial objectives efficiently.
Vendor and CRO Management:
Select, contract, and oversee third-party vendors, including CROs, ensuring quality deliverables and adherence to timelines.
Conduct regular performance reviews and risk assessments to maintain vendor accountability.
Site Management:
Lead site identification, initiation, and monitoring to ensure high-quality trial conduct.
Address site challenges proactively and implement corrective actions as needed.
Data Integrity and Reporting:
Ensure robust data collection, monitoring, and quality control processes.
Collaborate with biostatistics and data management teams for timely data analysis and reporting.

Required Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree in life sciences, pharmacy, or a related field.
Experience:
5+ years in clinical trial/project management, with a strong focus on CNS therapeutic areas.
Proven track record of managing international multi-site trials.
Hands-on experience with all phases of clinical trials, especially Phase I-III.
Skills:
Deep understanding of CNS disorders and their clinical development challenges.
Strong organizational, leadership, and decision-making abilities.
Proficiency in project management tools and systems.
Fluent in English and Italian (both written and verbal).

Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience in biotech or pharmaceutical CNS drug development.
Knowledge of emerging CNS therapies, biomarkers, or advanced trial designs.
Familiarity with Milan‚Äôs clinical research ecosystem and key opinion leaders.


What We Offer


An opportunity to work with a highly skilled and passionate team in a cutting-edge biotech environment.
Competitive salary, benefits, and performance-based incentives.
A collaborative culture fostering innovation and personal growth.
The chance to contribute to life-changing therapies for CNS disorders

Title: Senior Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

Siamo alla ricerca di un Senior Deep Learning Engineer altamente qualificato per unirsi al nostro team di AI.

Il candidato ideale avr√† una solida esperienza in reti neurali, transformer e modelli di linguaggio di grandi dimensioni (LLM). Sar√† responsabile dello sviluppo di progetti innovativi che avranno come focus l‚Äôapplicazione di modelli pre-addestrati e del training end-to-end di reti neurali con architetture Encoder o Decoder.

Fineco √® rinomata per le sue soluzioni innovative nel settore bancario, offrendo servizi di conto corrente, carte di pagamento, investimenti e trading. Con un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e collaborativo, Fineco √® al primo posto tra le banche italiane secondo Forbes.

Responsabilit√†


Progettare, sviluppare e implementare modelli di deep learning avanzati.
Eseguire il training end-to-end di reti neurali utilizzando architetture Encoder o Decoder.
Ottimizzare le prestazioni dei modelli e migliorare la loro efficienza.
Collaborare con altri team per integrare soluzioni di AI nei prodotti aziendali.
Mantenere aggiornate le conoscenze sulle ultime tecnologie e tendenze nel campo del deep learning.



Requirements


Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, o campo correlato.
Esperienza comprovata nello sviluppo e nel training di modelli di deep learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di reti neurali, transformer e LLM.
Esperienza con architetture Encoder e Decoder.
Esperienza documentata in ambito aziendale, preferibilmente bancario.
Capacit√† di analisi, implementazione e presentazione dei risultati a stakeholder business.
Esperienza con modelli di computer vision o multimodali.
Capacit√† di lavorare in modo indipendente e in team.
Eccellenti capacit√† di problem-solving e analitiche.
Buona conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python e framework di deep learning come PyTorch.



Other information

Cosa Offriamo


Opportunit√† di lavorare su progetti innovativi e all'avanguardia.
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e collaborativo.
Opportunit√† di crescita professionale e formazione continua.
Pacchetto retributivo competitivo e benefit aziendali.



Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Il Gruppo Fineco √® orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversit√†, offrendo pari opportunit√† di lavoro. Fineco ‚ÄúThe Place To Be‚Äù

Title: Global Sales Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

Amplifon is an Italian multinational company and the global leader in hearing care solutions and services. With over 20,000 professionals and a network of 10,000 points of sale in 26 countries, Amplifon helps people rediscover the emotions of sound. The company values people as the key to its success, offering growth opportunities in a multicultural and international environment. Amplifon has been recognized as a "Top Employer 2025" in Europe, North America and Latin America, Australia and New Zeland by the Top Employers Institute. Additionally, we are proud to be the first Italian multinational to be certified among the Global ‚ÄúLeading Employers‚Äù 2025. This recognition spans all 26 countries where we operate.

In Amplifon we believe people are the most important component of our success. Thanks to our best-in-class Hearing Care Professionals and front and back-office Teams, we are able to put the everyday taps, pops and splashes back into the lives of our customers. We believe that it‚Äôs only through strong investment in talent engagement, continuous professional development, support and recognition that our people can exceed every limit and build a fulfilling career.
¬†

Aligned to this goal, we offer a hybryd working policy, allowing employees to work 9 days/month remotely.

What we are looking for

The Global Sales Data & Analytics Specialist will join our Global team of Retail Excellence covering a key role in the development of advanced analysis, machine learning models and data visualization products. With exposure to the entire retail business, you will work to optimize sales strategies to generate new business opportunities and growth.

Main activities:


Works on strategically identified, cutting-edge data science use cases that cover the entire sales journey.
Uses advanced analytics methods to extract insights from business data.
Performs analysis and builds data-driven models to answer business questions and needs.
Create hypotheses and experiments to identify hidden relationships to direct new Sales strategies.
Develops visualizations and presentations to influence key stakeholders in implementing key recommendations from data science initiatives.
Develops machine learning models with the aim to facilitate Sales processes.
Collaborates with other team members across Marketing/CRM, IT, Reporting & Analytics to build shared data products, dashboards, and advanced analysis.


Skills and Experience:


Degree in quantitative fields like Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Economics, Computing and Engineering.
At least 2-3 years of experience in data science projects, preferably covering digital, customer or retail data science with experience in churn analytics, text analytics, customer segmentation, customer lifetime value model development and supporting operations.
Proficient with PowerBI, SQL, Python, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, or Pytorch.
Previous exposure to large language models or data governance/quality tools and techniques is considered a plus.
Able to build long-lasting relationships with peers in the organization based on trust.
Able to manage and coordinate the work of external resources, helping in the development of models and analysis.
Open minded to change and always seek to improve your way of working, knowledge and attitude.
A self-starter approach with the confidence to look beyond the ‚Äúhere and now‚Äù for the ‚Äúwhat could be‚Äù.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with conflicting time demands and multiple stakeholders
Have a strong inclination to data analysis combined with same attention to business impacts.
Possess strong analytical skills, mathematic abilities and critical thinking, a clear and open communication, relational and team building skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to share information.¬†
Excellent knowledge of Office package, with advanced expertise in Excel (pivot, macro, statistics formulas).
Working knowledge of code versioning and testing.
Nice to have: knowledge of Dataiku and GCP tools for data science.
Fluent in English

Who we are

Amplifon is an Italian multinational company and the global leader in hearing care solutions and services. With over 20,000 professionals and a network of 10,000 points of sale in 26 countries, Amplifon helps people rediscover the emotions of sound. The company values people as the key to its success, offering growth opportunities in a multicultural and international environment. Amplifon has been recognized as a "Top Employer 2025" in Europe, North America and Latin America, Australia and New Zeland by the Top Employers Institute. Additionally, we are proud to be the first Italian multinational to be certified among the Global ‚ÄúLeading Employers‚Äù 2025. This recognition spans all 26 countries where we operate.

In Amplifon we believe people are the most important component of our success. Thanks to our best-in-class Hearing Care Professionals and front and back-office Teams, we are able to put the everyday taps, pops and splashes back into the lives of our customers. We believe that it‚Äôs only through strong investment in talent engagement, continuous professional development, support and recognition that our people can exceed every limit and build a fulfilling career.
 

Aligned to this goal, we offer a hybryd working policy, allowing employees to work 9 days/month remotely.

What we are looking for

The Global Sales Data & Analytics Specialist will join our Global team of Retail Excellence covering a key role in the development of advanced analysis, machine learning models and data visualization products. With exposure to the entire retail business, you will work to optimize sales strategies to generate new business opportunities and growth.

Main activities:
  • Works on strategically identified, cutting-edge data science use cases that cover the entire sales journey.

  • Develops machine learning models with the aim to facilitate Sales processes.
  • Collaborates with other team members across Marketing/CRM, IT, Reporting & Analytics to build shared data products, dashboards, and advanced analysis.


Skills and Experience:
  • Degree in quantitative fields like Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Economics, Computing and Engineering.
  • At least 2-3 years of experience in data science projects, preferably covering digital, customer or retail data science with experience in churn analytics, text analytics, customer segmentation, customer lifetime value model development and supporting operations.
  • Proficient with PowerBI, SQL, Python, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, or Pytorch.
  • Previous exposure to large language models or data governance/quality tools and techniques is considered a plus.
  • Able to build long-lasting relationships with peers in the organization based on trust.
  • Able to manage and coordinate the work of external resources, helping in the development of models and analysis.
  • Open minded to change and always seek to improve your way of working, knowledge and attitude.
  • A self-starter approach with the confidence to look beyond the ‚Äúhere and now‚Äù for the ‚Äúwhat could be‚Äù.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with conflicting time demands and multiple stakeholders
  • Have a strong inclination to data analysis combined with same attention to business impacts.
  • Possess strong analytical skills, mathematic abilities and critical thinking, a clear and open communication, relational and team building skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to share information. 
  • Excellent knowledge of Office package, with advanced expertise in Excel (pivot, macro, statistics formulas).
  • Working knowledge of code versioning and testing.
  • Nice to have: knowledge of Dataiku and GCP tools for data science.
  • Fluent in English

Title: Python Developer
Description:
TeamSystem √® una Tech Company che da oltre 40 anni supporta la digitalizzazione. ‚ÄãSiamo leader in Europa nel settore delle soluzioni e dei servizi digitali per le imprese di ogni dimensione e settore. Aiutiamo le aziende a crescere, a migliorare i loro processi e a essere pi√π competitive sul mercato.‚Äã

Siamo diventati la societ√† di riferimento sulla Digital Innovation per le pi√π importanti organizzazioni del contesto economico italiano. Offriamo prodotti e servizi innovativi in ambito ERP, CRM, HR, Fatturazione Elettronica, Digital Payments, Business Intelligence, AI e molto altro. ‚Äã

Siamo sempre alla ricerca di nuove sfide e la nostra missione √® quella di portare il digitale in ogni impresa. ‚Äã

Come? Fornendo soluzioni innovative che semplifichino e ottimizzino i processi dei nostri clienti. ‚Äã

E non √® tutto: vogliamo creare valore per le nostre persone promuovendo una cultura di eccellenza, innovazione e pratiche di business etiche e responsabili.‚Äã Per questo investiamo sulle competenze, sul benessere e sulla crescita professionale dei nostri collaboratori.




Nell‚Äôottica di un miglioramento continuo delle attivit√† di analisi e per raggiungere livelli d‚Äôeccellenza nella qualit√† e gestione dei dati trattati, il team di Data, AI & Analytics √® alla ricerca di una figura di Python Developer che gestisca le attivit√† sulle tematiche AI e supporti i vari usecase sulla nostra piattaforma. Le attivit√† prevedono:




Sviluppo e manutenzione di una piattaforma basata su agenti AI (agentic AI) per l'integrazione di funzionalit√† avanzate in ambito Data, AI e Analytics.
Progettazione e implementazione di architetture software scalabili per orchestrare agenti intelligenti, con focus sull'ottimizzazione delle prestazioni.
Sviluppo di pipeline per l'elaborazione di dati strutturati e non strutturati, inclusa l'integrazione con database relazionali e database vettoriali.
Implementazione di modelli AI, inclusi LLM (Large Language Models) e tecnologie di fine-tuning o prompting, per soddisfare specifici use case aziendali.
Collaborazione interdisciplinare con data scientist, software/prompt engineers e stakeholder di prodotto per definire requisiti e priorit√† di sviluppo.
Monitoraggio e manutenzione delle soluzioni AI in produzione, garantendo affidabilit√†, sicurezza e conformit√† alle normative.
Documentazione tecnica chiara e dettagliata per facilitare il trasferimento di conoscenze all'interno del team.




Per svolgere le attivit√† saranno utili:

Conoscenza avanzata di Python, con esperienza in librerie per il machine learning e il deep learning (ad esempio TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Esperienza nello sviluppo di API e microservizi utilizzando framework come FastAPI, Flask o Django.
Familiarit√† con LLM e agenti AI, inclusa l'implementazione di catene di agenti e tecniche di Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Esperienza con database vettoriali (ad esempio Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus, MongoDB) e con strumenti per la gestione di dati strutturati (ad esempio SQL, PostgreSQL).
Conoscenza di architetture basate su container (Docker, Kubernetes) per il deployment di applicazioni scalabili.
Capacit√† di lavorare con strumenti di version control come Git e di gestire workflow CI/CD.
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP).




Soft Skill

IMPRENDITORIALIT√Ä ‚Äì Puntiamo all‚Äôeccellenza, al raggiungimento dei risultati e alla crescita dell‚Äôazienda superando gli interessi individuali; agiamo per il bene comune e per realizzare la strategia condivisa. Ci impegniamo in prima persona con spirito d‚Äôiniziativa e guidando chi sta intorno a noi. Siamo responsabili della qualit√† del nostro lavoro e supportiamo gli altri nel dare il meglio, pronti a sfidare lo status quo per comprendere, anticipare e soddisfare i bisogni del cliente;
INNOVAZIONE - Progettiamo, sperimentiamo e realizziamo nuove cose e nuovi modi di lavorare, ricercando soluzioni creative e imparando dagli errori. Siamo curiosi e valorizziamo leintuizioni di tutti, aperti ai contributi degli altri e sempre alla ricerca dell‚Äôidea migliore, dentro e fuori dall‚Äôorganizzazione. Anticipiamo il cambiamento e ci impegniamo a renderlo reale.
GROWTH MINDSET ‚Äì √® l'atteggiamento che ci spinge a cercare continuamente nuove sfide, opportunit√† e apprendimenti, senza lasciarci scoraggiare dagli ostacoli o dai fallimenti. √à la mentalit√† che ci permette di crescere come persone e come professionisti, sfruttando al meglio il nostro potenziale e quello degli altri.
INCLUSIONE - Nei nostri team diamo spazio ai diversi talenti che le persone incarnane, creiamo opportunit√† per farli crescere. Dalla pluralit√† di approcci e visioni costruiamo i valori e gli obiettivi comuni. Crediamo che dalla sintesi di diverse esperienze, conoscenze e sensibilit√† si possano generare le miglio risoluzioni e per questo creiamo le condizioni affinch√© tutti si possano esprimere al meglio. Rispettiamo gli individui e i punti di vista differenti dal nostro, vivendoli come opportunit√† di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:




WELLBEING: siamo tra le prime aziende italiane a puntare sul modello della settimana corta. Il venerd√¨ pomeriggio non lavoriamo per dedicarci ai nostri interessi personali e/o ai nostri affetti. E per metterti nelle condizioni migliori per farlo, √® previsto per ogni persona un piano di welfare individuale e personalizzato, creato appositamente per supportare il benessere tuo e delle persone che hai accanto;
DIVERSIT√Ä E INCLUSIVIT√Ä: siamo un luogo dove la diversit√† e l'inclusivit√† sono il fulcro di ci√≤ che siamo e di come lavoriamo. Promuoviamo una cultura aperta, collaborativa e rispettosa delle differenze. Il nostro modello di leadership √® partecipativo e basato sui concetti di fiducia e sviluppo del talento;
FLESSIBILIT√Ä: lo smart working √® parte integrante della nostra WoW (way of working) e per supportarti in tal senso √® stato previsto uno smart working pack, ovvero un kit di dotazioni necessario a far si che la tua esperienza lavorativa da remoto sia congrua ed efficace ‚Äì il kit comprende anche la connessione internet.
SVILUPPO E CRESCITA: abbiamo forte attenzione alla valorizzazione del talento individuale e alla volont√† di consolidamento delle competenze tecniche e di leadership delle nostre persone. Potrai accedere ad una vasta library di corsi per lo sviluppo di competenze hard e soft, in linea con le esigenze di sviluppo del tuo ruolo. Inoltre, sempre a supporto del talento, sono previsti piani di sviluppo personalizzati e organizzati in collaborazione con le principali business school italiane.
IMPATTO: Pensiamo che il nostro business abbia un impatto non solo in termini di profitto. Ci impegniamo a generare valore per i nostri clienti, i nostri partner, ma siamo consci della nostra responsabilit√† sociale e ambientale e aspiriamo a fare la differenza in ogni nostro progetto.




Sede di lavoro: Milano, Roma

Title: Data Science Expert
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced data science engineer who wants to lend your expertise to train AI models? Join our team of experts to train AI models for data science generation!

We partner with organizations to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models improve their output. Projects typically involve predictive modeling, classification, clustering, optimization, a/b testing, and/or anomaly detection that require interacting with these models as they learn. No previous AI experience is required.

About The Opportunity

Outlier is looking for talented Data Scientists to help train generative artificial intelligence models.

This freelance opportunity is remote with flexible hours, so you can work whenever is best for you. The general expectation is 30-40 hours of availability per week.

You Can Contribute With Your Expertise By


Developing and answering data science questions to help train AI models
Evaluating and classifying responses generated by AI models


Examples Of Experience


Currently pursuing or having completed a bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Data Science from a selective institution.
Proficiency in working with Data Science
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in written and spoken English.
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.


If you already have an Outlier account, please apply here:

https://forms.gle/God6XYypiSpAxvrd6


Please apply only if you meet the required skills and have a strong interest in the role.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, store, and use personal data for our business purposes, including notifying you about opportunities that may be of interest to you and sharing it with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to what we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage the needs of applicants, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect related to your application will be handled in accordance with Outlier's Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Since this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to register with Outlier if you have a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor for specific questions about your circumstances.

Title: Junior Software Engineer - Milano [DIG]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come Junior Software Engineer ‚Äì Associate


Your Perspectives

In PwC Digital Innovation ci occupiamo di realizzare progetti e prodotti con l'utilizzo di tecnologie all'avanguardia che abilitano nuovi servizi per il mercato. I punti di forza delle nostre soluzioni sono l'elevata qualit√† e il ridotto time to market, ottenuti utilizzando le metodologie Scrum e DevOps. Se ti piace la tecnologia e sei interessato ad applicarla a diversi settori di mercato, entra nel nostro team con il ruolo di Associate e avrai l'opportunit√† di:


  • Utilizzare tecnologie moderne apprendendone di nuove;
  • Lavorare in un contesto giovane e dinamico;
  • Conseguire certificazioni sulle maggiori tecnologie di mercato;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Seguire un percorso di carriera che ti permetter√† di acquisire competenze manageriali oltre che tecniche.


Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica;
  • Hai maturato un minimo di esperienza nell‚Äôambito di progettazione e sviluppo software con l‚Äôutilizzo di almeno una delle seguenti tecnologie: Angular, Java Spring Boot, NodeJS, Flutter;
  • Sei appassionato di tecnologia e consideri il linguaggio di sviluppo un mezzo per arrivare al tuo obiettivo;
  • Hai sviluppato capacit√† di ascolto attivo, di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Sei capace di lavorare in autonomia ove necessario;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza, curiosit√† e spiccato senso di responsabilit√† professionale;
  • Possiedi una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprender√† con un‚Äôopportunit√† di carriera che ti far√† sentire al centro della societ√†, dell‚Äôinnovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.


Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversit√† e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
EOS Solutions, Leader italiano nelle soluzioni Microsoft Dynamics, √® alla ricerca di un/una Junior Microsoft Business Applications AI Engineer per la sede di Milano.

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in D√ºsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel‚Äôs innovation network.

What You¬¥ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in D√ºsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field‚Äîfor example, a Bachelor‚Äôs in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel‚Äôs global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.
Show more

Title: Experienced Data Scientist Digital
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura consultant/senior consultant da inserire nel team Customer Analytics di Deloitte Digital nella sede di Milano/Roma che lavorer√† in modalit√† Hybrid.

Il team Customer Analytics di Deloitte Digital si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttivit√†, efficienza, qualit√† dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie.

Sarai coinvolto nel supporto delle attivit√† legate al mondo della marketing technology: dalla definizione strategica, all‚Äôanalisi dei requisiti di progetto alla definizione della sua architettura, dallo sviluppo funzionale dell‚Äôapplicativo fino alla sua delivery.

Your Role

La risorsa Experienced verr√† inserita in un team di lavoro:


Di sviluppatori impegnati nell'esecuzione di progetti e in attivit√† di ricerca e sviluppo (R&D).
Sar√† responsabile dello sviluppo e dell'implementazione di tecnologie all'avanguardia (Computer vision, NLP, GenAI).
I candidati ideali saranno esperti nell'uso di tecnologie all'avanguardia come computer vision, elaborazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP), GenAI, analisi delle serie temporali, reti neurali grafiche e altri sottodomini dell'AI/ML per risolvere complessi problemi aziendali in settori diversi come il consumo, i servizi finanziari, le telecomunicazioni, le utility, ecc.


Winning Requirements


Laurea triennale richiesta, preferibilmente in un campo correlato alle STEM (Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria, Fisica, Matematica, ecc.)
Oltre 2 anni di esperienza in data science e analisi di rete, inclusi lo sviluppo di algoritmi AI/ML e l'analisi dei dati nelle principali modalit√† di dati da NLP, analisi delle serie temporali, computer vision, a modelli grafici.
Oltre 2 anni di esperienza nei linguaggi di programmazione principali e nei pacchetti di data science (Python, Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter, XGBoost, lgbm ecc.)
Nice to Have:
Esperienza di lavoro con LLMs (GPT, LLaMA, Claude, ecc.) e modelli multimodali.
Capacit√† di implementare modelli AI in applicazioni reali utilizzando pipeline ML e servizi cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Solida comprensione della modellazione probabilistica, dell'apprendimento non supervisionato e delle tecniche di interpretabilit√† dei modelli.
Esperienza pratica con database vettoriali, generazione aumentata dal recupero (RAG) e ingegneria dei prompt.
Familiarit√† con le pratiche MLOps per il deployment e il monitoraggio scalabile dei modelli.
Esperienza con la containerizzazione (Docker) e lo sviluppo di API per il deployment e l'integrazione dei modelli √® un plus.

To Make an Impact that Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in pi√π di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte √® presente in 24 citt√† con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualit√† di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della societ√† di oggi. WorldImpact √® il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l‚Äôambiente e le comunit√† in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che ‚Äì in collaborazione con istituzioni, realt√† del terzo settore, universit√† e altri soggetti ‚Äì hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

Title: Senior Generative AI Specialist
Description:
CRIF, a prestigious and innovative international group specializing in informational solutions, decision models, outsourcing, software, and consulting services to support banks, financial companies, insurance agencies, utilities, and businesses, is seeking a Senior Generative AI Specialist. The successful candidate will join our ‚ÄúAdvanced Analytics Global‚Äù area, the Center of Excellence at CRIF that combines expertise in Data Science, Data Engineering, and Generative AI




Profile:

PhD or Master‚Äôs Degree in statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, quantitative economics, econometrics or a similar quantitative field.
3+ years of experience in Data Science / AI fields
Strong problem-solving skills and teamwork capabilities
Strong communication skills
Knowledge of major trends and technologies in AI/GenAI




Hard Skills:

Excellent knowledge of Python and Data Science libraries (Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-Learn, Keras, Pytorch, Matplotlib, requests, etc.)
Deep understanding of the fundamentals of statistics and machine learning (sampling theory, inference and interpretation, model validation, regression and classification techniques, etc.)
Experience in development and management of LLM pipelines
Deep understanding of LLM fine-tuning methods (ex: LoRa)
Experience working with one of the major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure, IBM)
Knowledge of MLOps and microservices architectures
Usage of IDE (Visualbasics, Pycharm)
Familiarity with version control tools (Git, CodeCommit, etc.)
Knowledge of Non-Relational Databases
High level proficiency in the Office suite, especially Excel




Nice to have:

Familiarity with Docker
Project portfolio (GitHub)
Research and publications in the AI field




Location: Milan




We offer a safe and inclusive enviroment where collegues are encouraged to think outside the box.




Crif is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive work environment and promoting equal opportunies during the employee life cycle .




We aim to attract and retain the best people and embracing gender, age, culture, religion and disability diversity.

Title: Junior Localization Engineer
Description:
Keywords Studios is an international technical and creative services provider to the global video games industry.

Established in 1998 and headquartered in Dublin, Keywords now has over 80 studios located across Europe, North America, South America and Asia. We provide integrated art production, engineering, audio services, testing, localization, marketing services and player support services across 50+ languages to a blue-chip client base located across 20+ countries. We have a strong market position, providing services to 23 of the top 25 most prominent games companies. With over 12,000 passionate gaming employees around the world, we provide services to video game developers and publishers alike.

See www.keywordsstudios.com for further information.

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior Localization Engineer to join our Global Localization Engineering team. You will work alongside our Localization Engineers and Project Managers to support the localization of video games across a wide range of platforms.

In this role, you'll play a key part in supporting the day-to-day requirements of the Project Managers and help the team to identify and resolve technical bottlenecks in localization workflows.

A core part of your responsibility will be to assist the team in their mission to increase automation and efficiency across project workflows.

You'll learn how to identify the root causes of issues in localization workflows and help the team develop effective, scalable solutions.

Key Responsibilities


Provide day-to-day technical support to Localization Project Managers
Assist in identifying pain points in existing workflows and propose areas for automation or improvement
Support setup of tools, environments, and file conversions for localization projects
Help extract localizable content and prepare files for translation
Troubleshoot basic issues related to translation assets and tools
Collaborate with senior engineers on tool development and script maintenance
Document recurring issues or inefficiencies for further analysis by the engineering team
Participate in testing and rollout of new tools or process updates
Ensure project data integrity and compliance with client requirements
Help maintain automation scripts and contribute to ongoing tool development efforts



Why Join Us?

As a Junior Localization Engineer at Keywords, you'll have the opportunity to work with some of the most recognized companies in the video game industry. This role is a stepping stone into advanced Localization Engineering and offers opportunities to grow your technical skills, collaborate with a global team, and contribute to solutions that help release multilingual games.

Requirements


University degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent experience
Basic knowledge or a strong interest in learning about markup languages (e.g., XML, HTML)
Basic understanding or strong interest in using regular expressions to extract text patterns
Basic knowledge or interest in learning to use CAT tools (memoQ, Phrase, CrowdIn, etc.)
Basic knowledge or interest in learning about localization processes and multilingual file handling
A service-oriented mindset and strong attention to detail
Ability to communicate clearly in English with both technical and non-technical colleagues
A desire to grow and contribute to a global team
Experience with the MS Office Suite, or Google Workspace



Desirable


Familiarity with data analysis or SQL
Knowledge of a wide variety of File Formats
Some experience or a strong interest in programming and scripting (e.g., Python, C#, VBA etc)
Understanding of internationalization (i18n) concepts
A passion for automation and scalable solutions


The gross annual salary for this position is about ‚Ç¨ 22,000.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:


University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets


Languages:


F lu ent in En g lish


Travels:


Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:

  • Asset management
  • Energy transition services
  • Energy supply & global commodities
  • Risk management & market access

At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üöÄ Join Movify ‚Äì Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don‚Äôt just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




ü§† What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company‚Äôs data strategy and best practices




ü§ì Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




üòç Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G‚Äôs supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G‚Äôs supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    YOUR ADVANTAGES:

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Job Schedule

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

    Job Segmentation

    Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üíºJob Title: Data Scientist

üë®‚ÄçüíªJob Type: Contract/Freelance

üìçLocation: Brussels, Belgium

üíºWork regime: Hybrid (3 Day Onsite in a Week)

üî•Keywords: Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services, Experience with Lang Chain and/or Lang Graph for creating AI Agents and Generative AI flows.










What you will be doing

As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right AI solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.




Mission Context

- Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art Gen AI technology.

- Translate business requests into AI applications.

- Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems.

- Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.

- Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value.

- Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams.

- Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other Data Scientists in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).




Degree & Experience

- PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)

- 3-5 years of relevant work experience in a business environment




Technical profile requirements

‚Ä¢ Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).

‚Ä¢ Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.

‚Ä¢ Experience with LangChain and/or LangGraph for creating AI Agents and Generative AI flows.

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods.

‚Ä¢ Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:

o Translating business requests into data requirements

o Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.

o Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).

o Deploying scalable AI applications to production.




Attitudes/Behavior

‚Ä¢ Passionate about AI and a constant learner

‚Ä¢ Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value

‚Ä¢ Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers

‚Ä¢ Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women‚Äôs Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America‚Äôs Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector ‚Äì Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients ‚Äî a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)‚Äî we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Show more
HTML:
(Medical R&D Sector ‚Äì Confidential Client)


About the role


On behalf of one of our clients ‚Äî a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)‚Äî we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

  • Senior Machine Learning Engineer
  • Medior Machine Learning Engineer


This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.


Responsibilities

  • Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
  • Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
  • Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
  • Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
  • Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
  • Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
  • Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
  • Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.


Profile Sought

  • Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
  • Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
  • Excellent command of Python.
  • Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
  • Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
  • Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required


Nice to Have

  • Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
  • Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
  • Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
  • Knowledge of GPU computing environments.


Offer

  • Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
  • Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
  • Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
  • Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
  • Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
  • Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As a collaborator in the Machine Learning team, you ensure the different predictive models and algorithms are running qualitatively and on time in the production environment also called the model factory. The mission of the machine learning engineer is key because this role makes the bridge between the products delivered by the Data Science team and the usage of the business.




The machine learning engineer will also cover some more technical missions as for example web scraping, POC‚Äôs concerning AI & Generative AI (in order to ensure a move to production for those POC‚Äôs).




The Machine Learning team is responsible for the quality of the models and as a consequence of the value created by the models that will be used by all the internal clients.




Your responsibilities:

Deploy large scale machine learning models and other scripts into production environment (in cloud and on-premise environments)
Review, optimize and simplify the code to ensure quality and reusability
Monitor the quality of input variables and the performances of the models‚Äô outputs.
Contribute to parts of the ML pipeline, such as data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate models into production.
Monitor model performance and updates models as needed
Solve well-defined machine learning problems and may work on smaller projects or parts of larger projects.
Apply existing algorithms and techniques to specific business problems




Specific expertise:

Expert understanding of git, experience with CI/CD pipelines;
Proficiency at Python and solid knowledge of at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow / Keras or PyTorch is a must.
Good knowledge of computational infrastructure;
Basic knowledge of Terraform;
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, general deep learning, predictive modelling and Generative AI in order to be able to challenge the inputs and the outputs produced by the Data Science team
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform, ML Ops principles and software development tools/best practices;
Expertise in Data Ingestion / Processing and Modelling: you are able to express complex data needs and understand data quality-cleansing processes & methods
Extensive Corporate Data Knowledge: aware of critical company business processes and underlying data, you are able to challenge data quality
Fluency in SQL for writing efficient queries on large datasets
Good knowledge of Linux operating system
Ability to write robust code in Python, R and Java
Good to have: good knowledge of networking, multiprocessing, parallel computing and real-time computations;
Should be able to challenge the inputs and outputs of AI and Gen AI products as well as the way it was built.




Your profile:

Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics) or equivalent work experience. with 2-5 years of experience in machine learning or related fields
Proficient in key machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Analytical thinking and self-learning spirit
Strong programming and data analytics skills
Able to work and collaborate transversally
Good communication and presentation skills (vulgarisation)
Collaboration skills (with other data scientists, data engineers and other teams)
Capacity to influence and engage, assertiveness and being diplomatic
Customer-oriented and pragmatic
Stress resistant
Fluent English and fluent French or Dutch




Our offer:

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.




Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sibling is looking for a Data Scientist for a leading insurer in Brussels, Belgium. This will be a long-term freelance assignment.




Role




Designing, developing, and implementing AI/data-driven solutions tailored to business needs using internal and external data.
Extracting and communicating actionable insights to support decision-making and problem-solving.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.
Continuously monitoring model accuracy and proactively identifying and fixing issues or data drifts.




Skills




At least 5 years of experience in data analysis, ideally within a commercial/business context.
Hands-on expertise in AI, GenAI, computer vision, NLP, and/or deep learning.
Advanced skills in Python, SQL, Power BI, and Databricks.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì you can clearly present complex data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in French or Dutch, and English.
Hybrid Working




Please, get in touch
