Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM‚Äôs and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM‚Äôs (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You‚Äôll work with McKinsey‚Äôs agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics ‚Äì generally predictive or geospatial in nature ‚Äì to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact ‚Äì redefining what it means to provide the ‚Äúbest of the firm‚Äù to our clients.

Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE‚Äôs core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients‚Äô most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call ‚ÄúIP development‚Äù) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client‚Äôs needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client‚Äôs needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)‚Ä¶
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java ‚Ä¶
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Job Description:

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert will be based in Brussels, Belgium. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client‚Äôs IT team on site.


Your Tasks:

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.


Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Python, NLP, Machine Learning;
  • Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio);
  • Excellent knowledge of Perl, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas);
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Management;
  • Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
  • Good knowledge of Linux, Unix and Bash;
  • Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies;
  • Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase;
  • Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot;
  • Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Excellent command of the English language and a good understanding of French.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üìç Brussels, Belgium - Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)



Make real impact with data in the world of DIY & retail
For a leading company in the DIY and home improvement retail sector in the Benelux, we are looking for an experienced Senior or Mid-level Data Scientist. With millions of customers across Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg, this organization helps people build, improve, and personalize their homes.

As they move through a major data-driven transformation, they are seeking a data expert who can turn complex data into real business value through insights and AI-powered solutions.



What you'll do



Turn data into business impact: Work closely with Marketing, Operations, Finance, and other departments to solve challenges using data and AI

Build end-to-end solutions: Develop and deploy machine learning models and optimize processes from A to Z

Work with big data: Analyze large and complex datasets from retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and supply chain systems

Collaborate with stakeholders: Work alongside data engineers, product owners, and external partners to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions

Translate data into insights: Communicate complex findings in a clear, actionable way to non-technical stakeholders

Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and cloud technology

Operate in an agile environment: Use Agile/Kanban methods to prioritize and deliver value efficiently



Who we're looking for



Technical skills



Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Databricks, Python, and PySpark

Skilled in Power BI for dashboarding and reporting

Experience building and deploying machine learning models

Familiarity with retail, e-commerce, or supply chain datasets

Experience with end-to-end data pipelines and putting ML models into production

Experience with SAP systems (CAR, BW, ECOMMERCE) is a strong plus



Business & soft skills



Able to translate data insights into strategic business advice

Strong communicator with the ability to tell clear stories with data

Comfortable managing internal and external stakeholders

Thrives in a fast-paced Agile environment

Knowledge or interest in DIY/retail sector is a plus



Language requirements



English is required

French or Dutch is a plus



What's in it for you



A key role in the digital transformation of a leading Benelux retailer

Work with modern technologies and cloud tools

Hybrid working with flexibility and autonomy

Join an ambitious team making a real impact on millions of customers

Show more
HTML:
üìç Brussels, Belgium - Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)

Make real impact with data in the world of DIY & retail
 For a leading company in the DIY and home improvement retail sector in the Benelux, we are looking for an experienced Senior or Mid-level Data Scientist. With millions of customers across Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg, this organization helps people build, improve, and personalize their homes.

As they move through a major data-driven transformation, they are seeking a data expert who can turn complex data into real business value through insights and AI-powered solutions.

What you'll do

  • Turn data into business impact: Work closely with Marketing, Operations, Finance, and other departments to solve challenges using data and AI

  • Build end-to-end solutions: Develop and deploy machine learning models and optimize processes from A to Z

  • Work with big data: Analyze large and complex datasets from retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and supply chain systems

  • Collaborate with stakeholders: Work alongside data engineers, product owners, and external partners to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions

  • Translate data into insights: Communicate complex findings in a clear, actionable way to non-technical stakeholders

  • Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and cloud technology

  • Operate in an agile environment: Use Agile/Kanban methods to prioritize and deliver value efficiently

Who we're looking for



Technical skills

  • Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Databricks, Python, and PySpark

  • Skilled in Power BI for dashboarding and reporting

  • Experience building and deploying machine learning models

  • Familiarity with retail, e-commerce, or supply chain datasets

  • Experience with end-to-end data pipelines and putting ML models into production

  • Experience with SAP systems (CAR, BW, ECOMMERCE) is a strong plus

Business & soft skills

  • Thrives in a fast-paced Agile environment

  • Knowledge or interest in DIY/retail sector is a plus

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Role: B2b contract

Rate: 570 Euros per day


Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Python, NLP, Machine Learning;
  • Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio);
  • Excellent knowledge of Perl, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas);
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Management;
  • Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
  • Good knowledge of Linux, Unix and Bash;
  • Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies;
  • Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase;
  • Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot;
  • Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Excellent command of the English language and a good understanding of French.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ArŒ∑s Group ‚Äì part of Accenture - is a market leader in the management of complex IT projects and systems. Founded in Luxembourg in 2003, we have grown to encompass 12 entities worldwide, employing over 2,500 employees in Luxembourg, Belgium, Greece, Italy, Portugal and Bulgaria. With our focus on getting things done, we help our clients achieve their goals with best-of-breed solutions, superior execution and exceptional services. We offer bespoke software development, data science, infrastructure, digital trust and mobile development to government institutions at national and European level, telecom providers, and financial institutions, among others. Our bold company culture is built around working hard and playing hard, with a flat and agile structure that lends itself to efficiency and employee empowerment. We value our diverse workplace of close-knit teams and provide a place where everyone can be supported to learn and evolve.




Job Description

ARHS Group - part of Accenture - is looking for a Data Scientist for one of its clients at the EU Institutions in Brussels.




Role & Responsibilities

Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution
Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience
Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL)
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Scripting and programming.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc‚Ä¶)
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.




Qualifications

Your profile

Bachelor‚Äôs degree with a focus on Data management or equivalent experience
Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously
Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering
Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form




Technical skills

Excellent knowledge of Data Science techniques especially in machine learning and NLP. Prior experience with Large Language Model is considered an asset
Extensive experience in data analysis, with the ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights
Clean and transform raw data into a usable format for analysis. This includes designing and deploying Extraction Transformation and Load (ETL) processes
Produces data models according to specific problems statements
Knowledge and experience working in cloud environments
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences
Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments




Specific Expertise:

Experience with Statistics & Data Analytics
Proficiency in R and Python
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in Data Science and AI. Excellent command of Python and proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace;
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in the following areas 1) Oracle RDMBS Database development, 2) Data Modelling and SQL; 3) ETL tools (e.g. BODI, BODS Apache Airflow, dbt);
Minimum 2 year of professional experience with data visualisation and/or BI tools (e.g. Power BI);
Track record of implemented solutions that solved business problems and produced tangible results
Minimum 2 year with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control system (Git Hub)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Position Overview




We are seeking a skilled MLOps Engineer / AI Engineer to join our team in Brussels. In this role, you will be instrumental in bridging the gap between Data Science initiatives and IT operations. You will focus on the deployment, monitoring, and optimization of machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring smooth integration into organizational infrastructure. Additionally, you will be involved in lifecycle management, scalability improvements, and performance optimization of AI systems.




Key Responsibilities




Model Deployment: Work closely with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models into production, adhering to best practices in security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated, efficient data pipelines to enable continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Support project teams by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment workflows.
Data Flow Design: Build and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage solutions, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI-driven applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Utilize Kubernetes to manage the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource usage and system reliability.
Incident Management: Respond promptly to incidents, troubleshoot technical issues, communicate updates to stakeholders, and conduct root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Investigate and implement innovative solutions to improve AI capabilities and streamline model integration.




Requirements




Education

Solid knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.




Technical Expertise

Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have: Experience with SQL, PostgreSQL, MLflow, and Helm charts.




Soft Skills

Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.




Language Proficiency

Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Proficiency in Dutch or French is required.







If this opportunity is interesting for you, please forward your CV to Lkiani@montash.be OR simply apply via LinkedIn.

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged ‚Äì to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production ‚Äì and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders ‚Äì clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,‚Ä¶


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,‚Ä¶
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE‚Äôs, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD‚Äôs, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,‚Ä¶) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that‚Äôs transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimize rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we‚Äôre looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We‚Äôre looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology‚Äî all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we‚Äôre tackling challenges no one has solved before. That‚Äôs why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset‚Äîpeople who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.







What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.
Show more

Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.


Your main responsibilities:

  • Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
  • Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
  • Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
  • Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
  • Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.


Who you are:

  • Machine learning and NLP expertise:
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
  • Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
  • Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
  • Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.



What we offer:

  • Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
  • Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
  • The possibility to work flexibly.
  • Become part of a team of international high performers.
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
  • Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
A leading name within pharmaceuticals requires a Lead AI Engineer to join their expanding regional team. The successful candidate will help build a distributed AI team aimed at transforming enterprise processes. Ideal candidates have overseen the launch of AI-driven tools involving structured/unstructured data, graph/vector databases, and intuitive interfaces. Familiarity with agent-based AI, robust operational pipelines, and ethical AI governance is key.




Responsibilities:

Define and lead the roadmap for generative AI capabilities aligned with strategic goals.

Recruit and mentor global AI talent and manage budgets and delivery teams.

Stay current on GenAI trends and research, guide architecture decisions, and implementation.

Partner with business and technical teams to define impactful use cases.

Champion modern engineering workflows (DevOps/LLMOps) and scalable solutions.




Ideal Candidate:

Advanced degree (PhD preferred) in STEM or related field.

Proven experience in leading AI teams and projects.

Cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and related AI services.

Deep knowledge of LLM libraries (e.g., LangChain, Semantic Kernel, Autogen).

Strong engineering skills, API/backend/frontend experience.

Familiarity with CI/CD, observability tools, and AI model monitoring.




If this role sounds like a good match to your skillset and you would like to learn more, please apply.

Title: AI Developer
Description:
Ben jij gepassioneerd door artifici√´le intelligentie, algoritmes en innovatieve planningsoplossingen?

Wij zoeken een AI Developer die mee het verschil wil maken in de verdere ontwikkeling van Sheepblue, onze nieuwe AI-software voor personeelsplanning.

Protime is een succesvolle internationale aanbieder van Workforce Management oplossingen. Met onze software en expertise helpen wij bedrijven om effici√´nter om te gaan met de tijd van hun werknemers: hun Human Capital, dus. Bij Protime krijg je de kans om te groeien, nieuwe dingen te proberen, je talenten te benutten en verder te ontplooien, ‚Ä¶ Er heerst een sfeer van samenwerking: together we get the job done. Je krijgt veel autonomie en kan ownership nemen in je rol, maar je staat er nooit alleen voor.

Om ons workforce management portfolio verder uit te breiden, hebben we recent Sheepblue, een Oostenrijkse start-up, overgenomen. Sheepblue is een AI-software voor personeelsplanning, gespecialiseerd in sectoren die werken met ploegendiensten en nauwkeurige planningsmogelijkheden vereisen, zoals de productie- of logistieke sector.

Wat je zal doen bij Protime als AI Developer

We zijn op zoek naar iemand met een passie voor het optimaliseren van AI-algoritmes, die graag wil bijdragen aan de verdere ontwikkeling van onze Sheepblue-toepassing en de integratie ervan binnen de Protime Suite.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden:


Ondersteunen van complexe planningsscenario‚Äôs en het analyseren van onverklaarbare resultaten van het AI-algoritme.
Diepgaand inzicht verwerven in het AI-planningsalgoritme, met specifieke focus op de Monte Carlo Tree Search-methodiek.
Verbeteren van het algoritme door aanvullende technieken toe te passen, zoals lokale zoekstrategie√´n na Monte Carlo Tree Search.
Nieuwe algoritmes onderzoeken en implementeren om de planningskwaliteit te verhogen.
De AI-module uitbreiden zodat deze compatibel is met Strobbo.


Ben jij de AI Developer die we zoeken?


Je bent een zelfstandige werker met een passie voor artifici√´le intelligentie, innovatie en continue verbetering.
Je beschikt over een master- of bachelordiploma in Computerwetenschappen, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Toegepaste Informatica of een gelijkwaardige richting.
Je hebt ervaring met AI-gedreven systemen en beschikt over een sterke wiskundige basis in algoritmes, optimalisatie en beslissingsmodellen.
Kennis van productieplannings¬≠processen is een pluspunt.
Sterke programmeervaardigheden (bij voorkeur in Kotlin/Java en Angular) zijn een plus.
Ervaring met .NET Core en/of React is mooi meegenomen.
Je bent een uitstekende communicator en kunt zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband goed werken.
Je hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen en neemt graag initiatief.


Waarom voor Protime kiezen? ‚åö


Protime is een groeibedrijf met een internationale mindset. Dat betekent dat jij impact kan maken, jezelf voortdurend kan blijven ontwikkelen en kan meegroeien met het bedrijf.
Werken bij Protime staat voor werken binnen een omgeving met snelle beslissingsprocedures en korte communicatielijnen. We omarmen verandering en nieuwe idee√´n worden volop aangemoedigd.
We houden ervan ons werk en elkaar naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Samen presteren op ons best en voldoening halen uit ons werk: daar gaan we voor!
Bij ons werk je hybride: afwisselend vanop ons kantoor in Mechelen en van thuis. De werktijden zijn flexibel. De focus ligt op de kwaliteit van je werk.
Je brutoloon wordt aangevuld met een wagen en tankkaart, maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, ecocheques, eindejaarspremie, jaarbonus, voucher voor een GSM, GSM-abonnement, FIP-plan (Flex Income Plan of cafetariaplan).
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description: We are seeking a talented Data Scientist freelancer to join our clients' teams. Whether you are a medior, experienced, or an expert, we have opportunities tailored to your skill level and career aspirations.




All of the offers are located in Brussels, or Belgium in general and hybrid work is often required with on-site days.




Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and algorithms.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data-driven solutions to business problems.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to provide actionable insights.
Write and maintain technical documentation for data analysis processes.
Ensure the quality and accuracy of data through rigorous testing and validation.




Technical Skills Required:

Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques.
Experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries (such as pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn).
Familiarity with SQL, MySQL, Oracle databases.
Understanding of data visualization tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib).
Knowledge of Clouds like AWS, GCP, Azure.




Soft Skills:

Team spirit and collaboration.
Adaptability and flexibility.
Proactivity and initiative.
Excellent communication skills.
Job type : Freelance/Independent only




Languages : Dutch is mandatory with a native or bilingual level.

English is mandatory with a professional level minimum.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA‚Äôs Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve idee√´n uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‚Äòbusiness-as-usual‚Äô proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het ‚ÄúACA Innovation Lab‚Äù zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe idee√´n en technologie√´n af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, ‚Ä¶)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We‚Äôve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega‚Äôs gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge tech with cinematic magic.




Position: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Remote in Europe

Salary up to $90,000




You will build and deploy AI models that power groundbreaking filmmaking tools. Collaborate globally, code with precision, and drive innovation through data-driven testing.




Role:

Craft robust and efficient machine learning pipelines tailored for filmmaking applications.
Deliver clean, well-documented, and maintainable Python code.
Conduct rigorous A/B testing and performance analysis to optimize models and ensure they meet key metrics.
Ensure models are deployed effectively in production environments, leveraging cloud services and containerization.




Qualifications:

Deep Python/PyTorch expertise
3+ years relevant ML experience
Experienced with 3D Mesh
Big bonus if you have GenAI Experience i.e. Flux, Stable Diffusion

Title: AI First Developer
Description:
About Smartcat

Smartcat is on a mission to become the wall-to-wall Language AI platform, addressing the diverse needs in multilingual content for various user personas within global enterprises.

Smartcat is uniquely positioned within the $100+ billion multilingual content industry, which is currently served by tens of thousands of agencies. This results in a highly fragmented and inefficient supply chain, high costs, unacceptable turnaround times, and quality issues. Using highly qualified internal resources to translate or create multilingual content (insourcing) solves the quality problem for enterprises, but if done manually, it can't solve for scalability, high cost, and slow turnaround.

Smartcat changes the ROI equation in favor of insourcing with its Language AI platform for enterprise end-users. It delivers high-quality, instantaneous AI translations or generates new content in any language by tapping into a customer-specific multilingual content library. The AI output is further refined through human editing by the client's internal reviewers or experts from the Smartcat's embedded global marketplace of linguists and content editors. This AI output continuously improves through the editing feedback loop, ensuring consistent and customer-tailored results.

More than 1,000 global companies including ~20% of the Fortune 1,000 trust Smartcat to communicate their innovations and ideas all over the world.

As a dynamic Series C company, Smartcat is growing at 130% YoY, thanks to the high and quick ROI it delivers to global enterprises. It's well-funded by notable VCs, and is capital efficient, offering a unique blend of hyper-growth potential with downside protection and the capacity for long-term planning and strategy.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR TEAM

We are building the future of software development ‚Äî AI-First is the new standard. You won‚Äôt be ‚Äúexperimenting‚Äù; you‚Äôll be delivering. Fast. Smart. Relentless. Join the core team that will prove AI-driven engineering is the only way forward. If you love challenges, own your outcomes, and are obsessed with delivery, you‚Äôll thrive here.

MISSION

As an AI-First Engineer, your mission is to deliver production-quality features at a speed and scale that traditional teams cannot match. You will apply AI aggressively across every stage of the development lifecycle ‚Äî from requirements and design to coding, testing, and release ‚Äî and establish a new engineering benchmark for the company.

OUTCOMES


Consistently deliver high-quality, production-grade features faster than traditional teams.
Build and optimize AI-first workflows that integrate AI across all development stages.
Raise the bar for speed, quality, and ownership in product delivery.
Be a core contributor to the new engineering culture built on AI-First principles.


How You‚Äôll Ramp

By Day 30:


Deeply understand our AWS, .NET, Python, MongoDB tech stack and delivery model.
Start shipping real features using AI at every stage: coding, testing, documenting, releasing.
Contribute to improving workflows for even faster delivery.


By Day 60


Independently own the full lifecycle of feature delivery through AI-first methods.
Identify and drive improvements in velocity, automation, and team efficiency.
Partner with Product and Tech Leads to aggressively accelerate time-to-market.


By Day 90


Deliver features faster and with higher quality than baseline teams.
Actively mentor others on using AI as a multiplier across development.
Become a key driver of the AI-First engineering standard inside the company.


What You‚Äôve Accomplished


Proven track record of delivering production-grade products using AI-driven approach.
Mastery in using AI tools (Copilot/Cursor/WindSurf (etc, you choose), GPT APIs, LLMs) across the entire development lifecycle ‚Äî design, code generation, testing, documentation, and release.
Strong technical foundation in AWS, .NET, Python, and MongoDB.
Obsessed with delivery: you ship, you improve, you own the outcome.
Comfortable moving fast, taking ownership, and constantly pushing for better, faster, smarter execution.


Why joining Smartcat might be your best move so far


Fully remote team We are a global team of 200+ enthusiastic people spread across 30+ countries. We have been fully remote since 2020, with some locations populated with more Smartcaters than others, such as Boston, NYC, SF, the Bay Area, London, and Lisbon.
Innovating a $100 Billion industry Smartcat‚Äôs innovative approach towards multilingual content, taps into a $100B industry. Our platform enables enterprise end users to stop using traditional outsourcing methods, and start enjoying an easy-to-use, AI-powered SaaS, that delivers immediate high-quality results, at a fraction of the cost.
High impact role enabling innovation and inclusion in organizations You will enjoy building with us. You will drive changes in how an old-fashioned global language industry operates while improving how hundreds of thousands of people work and millions of people exchange knowledge and ideas worldwide.
Join the rocketship to scale-up 10x and beyond together We are looking for someone to become an integral part of our team and play a crucial role in the most exciting part of our journey: transitioning from a post-Series C startup to a company exceeding $100M in ARR and $1B in valuation. Our journey isn‚Äôt for the faint of heart. We are growing at 130% YoY, thanks to our strong product-market fit and high-performing team, and plan to accelerate from here.
Smartcat Culture: Where Diversity Meets High Performance At Smartcat, we are committed to building a culture that highlights respect and appreciation for each individual's unique background and perspective, while maintaining a strong focus on results and clear, honest and direct communication. We believe in welcoming everyone and fostering an inclusive environment where team members can be their authentic selves at work. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is steadfast, and we stand firmly against discrimination and harassment.

About Smartcat

Smartcat is on a mission to become the wall-to-wall Language AI platform, addressing the diverse needs in multilingual content for various user personas within global enterprises.

Smartcat is uniquely positioned within the $100+ billion multilingual content industry, which is currently served by tens of thousands of agencies. This results in a highly fragmented and inefficient supply chain, high costs, unacceptable turnaround times, and quality issues. Using highly qualified internal resources to translate or create multilingual content (insourcing) solves the quality problem for enterprises, but if done manually, it can't solve for scalability, high cost, and slow turnaround.

Smartcat changes the ROI equation in favor of insourcing with its Language AI platform for enterprise end-users. It delivers high-quality, instantaneous AI translations or generates new content in any language by tapping into a customer-specific multilingual content library. The AI output is further refined through human editing by the client's internal reviewers or experts from the Smartcat's embedded global marketplace of linguists and content editors. This AI output continuously improves through the editing feedback loop, ensuring consistent and customer-tailored results.

More than 1,000 global companies including ~20% of the Fortune 1,000 trust Smartcat to communicate their innovations and ideas all over the world.

As a dynamic Series C company, Smartcat is growing at 130% YoY, thanks to the high and quick ROI it delivers to global enterprises. It's well-funded by notable VCs, and is capital efficient, offering a unique blend of hyper-growth potential with downside protection and the capacity for long-term planning and strategy.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR TEAM

We are building the future of software development ‚Äî AI-First is the new standard. You won‚Äôt be ‚Äúexperimenting‚Äù; you‚Äôll be delivering. Fast. Smart. Relentless. Join the core team that will prove AI-driven engineering is the only way forward. If you love challenges, own your outcomes, and are obsessed with delivery, you‚Äôll thrive here.

MISSION

As an AI-First Engineer, your mission is to deliver production-quality features at a speed and scale that traditional teams cannot match. You will apply AI aggressively across every stage of the development lifecycle ‚Äî from requirements and design to coding, testing, and release ‚Äî and establish a new engineering benchmark for the company.

OUTCOMES

  • Consistently deliver high-quality, production-grade features faster than traditional teams.
  • Build and optimize AI-first workflows that integrate AI across all development stages.
  • Raise the bar for speed, quality, and ownership in product delivery.
  • Be a core contributor to the new engineering culture built on AI-First principles.

How You‚Äôll Ramp

By Day 30:

  • Deeply understand our AWS, .NET, Python, MongoDB tech stack and delivery model.
  • Start shipping real features using AI at every stage: coding, testing, documenting, releasing.
  • Contribute to improving workflows for even faster delivery.

By Day 60

  • Independently own the full lifecycle of feature delivery through AI-first methods.
  • Identify and drive improvements in velocity, automation, and team efficiency.
  • Partner with Product and Tech Leads to aggressively accelerate time-to-market.

By Day 90

  • Deliver features faster and with higher quality than baseline teams.
  • Actively mentor others on using AI as a multiplier across development.
  • Become a key driver of the AI-First engineering standard inside the company.

What You‚Äôve Accomplished

  • Proven track record of delivering production-grade products using AI-driven approach.
  • Mastery in using AI tools (Copilot/Cursor/WindSurf (etc, you choose), GPT APIs, LLMs) across the entire development lifecycle ‚Äî design, code generation, testing, documentation, and release.
  • Strong technical foundation in AWS, .NET, Python, and MongoDB.
  • Obsessed with delivery: you ship, you improve, you own the outcome.
  • Comfortable moving fast, taking ownership, and constantly pushing for better, faster, smarter execution.

Why joining Smartcat might be your best move so far

  • Fully remote team We are a global team of 200+ enthusiastic people spread across 30+ countries. We have been fully remote since 2020, with some locations populated with more Smartcaters than others, such as Boston, NYC, SF, the Bay Area, London, and Lisbon.
  • Innovating a $100 Billion industry Smartcat‚Äôs innovative approach towards multilingual content, taps into a $100B industry. Our platform enables enterprise end users to stop using traditional outsourcing methods, and start enjoying an easy-to-use, AI-powered SaaS, that delivers immediate high-quality results, at a fraction of the cost.
  • High impact role enabling innovation and inclusion in organizations You will enjoy building with us. You will drive changes in how an old-fashioned global language industry operates while improving how hundreds of thousands of people work and millions of people exchange knowledge and ideas worldwide.
  • Join the rocketship to scale-up 10x and beyond together We are looking for someone to become an integral part of our team and play a crucial role in the most exciting part of our journey: transitioning from a post-Series C startup to a company exceeding $100M in ARR and $1B in valuation. Our journey isn‚Äôt for the faint of heart. We are growing at 130% YoY, thanks to our strong product-market fit and high-performing team, and plan to accelerate from here.
  • Smartcat Culture: Where Diversity Meets High Performance At Smartcat, we are committed to building a culture that highlights respect and appreciation for each individual's unique background and perspective, while maintaining a strong focus on results and clear, honest and direct communication. We believe in welcoming everyone and fostering an inclusive environment where team members can be their authentic selves at work. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is steadfast, and we stand firmly against discrimination and harassment.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI Engineer




Location: Remote




My client at the forefront of AI innovation, working on groundbreaking projects that push the limits of what artificial intelligence can achieve. We are looking for a skilled Generative AI Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us develop cutting-edge AI models using TensorFlow and PyTorch.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and optimize AI models.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to integrate models into real-world applications.
Develop and maintain TensorFlow and PyTorch-based solutions.
Experiment with and enhance current generative models to improve accuracy and performance.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI research and best practices.




Required Skills & Experience:

Proficiency in TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and neural networks.
Experience with generative models
Solid programming skills in Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms is a plus.




üîó Apply now or message me directly for more details about the role!

Title: R&D Data Science internship
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Are you passionate about the science behind products? Do you want to develop innovations for the world's biggest brands? Then a technical career at P&G could be what you are looking for!

Join us for an internship and you could soon leave your mark in fields like natural sciences, materials, automation, sustainability, analytics, simulation and modelling through your project.

We are looking for R&D Data Science intern who will help Fabric & Home Care by leveraging data-driven insights through machine learning and deep learning techniques, including convolutional neural networks, to enhance product and packaging performance and innovate solutions that meet consumer needs. In this role, you will analyze consumer data and develop predictive models all while collaborating with a dynamic team.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G‚ÄôS SUCCESS:


You will get a chance to gain industrial experience and experience what working with us is like;
You will be responsible for your own project(s) from day 1 and put your technical skills to work on some of the toughest technical challenges;
You will improve your collaboration and management skills through practical experience and interactive training courses;
You get to experience the working environment in a leading international company and learn to work effectively with people of different nationalities and cultural backgrounds.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


Masters students in Software engineering, Data science, Data engineering, instead of just Software Engineering.
Students who will be enrolled at university for the full period of the internship
Demonstrated history of academic excellence at all stages through school and university education
Good command of English
Passion and ability to take initiative and make things happen
Be technically curious, creative and innovative
Have a good communication and collaboration skills
If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.


YOUR ADVANTAGES:


A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours;
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000127710

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Science Specialist - OptimusAI (Manufacturing / Industry)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will be based in our Brussels office as part of McKinsey‚Äôs manufacturing AI solution (OptimusAI), which sits at the intersection of three practices

Global Energy and Materials advises production and investor companies across chemicals & agriculture, paper & packaging, metals & mining, oil & gas, and power generation on strategic, operational, and growth issues.

QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey the AI arm of our firm which helps clients transform faster, innovate smart, and anticipate the future.

Operations assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges by developing and implementing operational strategies, initiatives and solutions for their most critical problems. Connecting boardroom strategies to the shopfloor operators.

At the intersection of these groups, OptimusAI is a team of ~10 expert consultants, data scientists and engineers, focused on improving processing plant productivity through data analytics.

We develop real-time AI advisory systems to support decision making in the plant control room, we assess and optimize process control systems, and we unlock plant bottlenecks through data-driven process changes.

OptimusAI supports a global community of consultants by developing an innovative machine learning toolkit and codifying the approach to deliver significant and lasting client impact.

Your Impact

Are you passionate about leveraging analytics to drive real-world impact? As an OptimusAI Data Science Specialist, you will help leading companies across the Energy and Materials sector unlock their full productivity potential using AI.

Collaborating in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team of 3-6 experts, you will use your creativity and analytics expertise to enhance client performance in areas such as energy efficiency, product quality, and capacity. You will be working side-by-side with the client‚Äôs process engineers and analytics specialists and will be communicating your work to executive audiences.

Internally, you will collaborate with our talented product engineers to develop innovative products and algorithms to address current and future client needs. You will help codify best practices, radiate our impact in/externally and shape the product roadmap.

Along the way, you will benefit from world-class training in business problem structuring and client advisory, while working closely with senior manufacturing and analytics experts. Experience unparalleled career growth with significant ownership and responsibility from day one, all within a collaborative, diverse, and non-hierarchical environment. Seize the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world.

Ready to deliver direct impact on some of the world's largest industrial players? We invite you to submit a cover letter detailing why you are the perfect fit for our team and how you can contribute to our mission!

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a discipline such as Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Machine Learning or equivalent
4+ years of relevant professional experience in advanced analytics, ideally in the context of heavy industry
Ability to write clean and efficient code in Python; ideally with experience in using cloud computing resources (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure)
Ability to apply and advise on state-of-the-art analytics, machine learning, and optimization techniques to derive business insights and solve complex problems
Excellent problem-solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and effective solutions
Ability to thrive in a flexible, multi-disciplinary and agile working environment
Strong interpersonal communication skills; experience in facilitating discussions with leadership
Track record of completing projects successfully on time as per scope
Willingness to travel to other offices and/or client locations for short/long term assignments

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Senior Data Scientist (7+ Years)




Location: Brussels (Hybrid)

Duration: 18-Month Contract

Industry: Technology

Start Date: ASAP / Flexible




About the Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist (Freelance) to help us unlock the full potential of our data. Based in Brussels, our technology company is scaling rapidly, and we need someone who can bridge advanced modelling with real-world impact. This is an opportunity to shape critical AI and ML initiatives in a fast-moving, product-driven environment. Hybrid work setup with the flexibility you expect as a senior freelancer.




You‚Äôll lead the development of a predictive recommendation system aimed at increasing user engagement on a core digital platform. This project includes selecting relevant features from behavioural data, training and validating machine learning models, and working with product and engineering teams to bring the solution into production. The recommendations will support a more personalized user experience across web and mobile interfaces, and your input will shape both the algorithm and its user-facing applications.




Responsibilities

Develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning models that drive product personalization, automation, or business forecasting
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business problems and translate them into data science use cases
Lead end-to-end data science projects: from problem framing, data wrangling, model development, evaluation, and implementation
Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure model integration into scalable data pipelines and products
Communicate findings clearly and effectively to technical teams and business stakeholders
Mentor and guide other team members where needed, helping level up the overall data maturity




Qualifications

7+ years of experience in data science or machine learning roles, ideally in a product or tech-led environment
Strong skills in Python (NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.) and SQL; familiarity with PyTorch or TensorFlow is a plus
Proven experience deploying ML models in production environments
Comfortable working with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure) and version control (e.g., Git)
Experience with model monitoring, explainability, and performance tuning
Ability to communicate technical ideas clearly and work cross-functionally
Fluent in English; Dutch or French is a plus

Title: Senior Data Scientist (AI/ML Focus)
Description:
Description

We're a global IT consulting company and a software development service provider that helps organizations operate at their best. With 30+ years of experience, +6 Global locations, and +1000 employees, TEAM combines technology expertise, valuable insights, business intelligence, and a client-centered approach to address challenges in business operations, digital transformation, risk management, compliance, business continuity, and more.




The client is implementing a new system for anti-money laundering in 30 of their subsidiaries around the world.

The technical part of the project involves assessment of the source data in each country and statistical modelling to set up the new system: segmentation of customers and parametrization of detection scenarios.




Profile requirements:

At least a bachelor's degree in data science or a similar field
At least 12 years of experience with development of machine learning or AI models
Good understanding of machine learning algorithms for classification and clustering
Experience with analysis or processing of financial transactions
Python, Spark and Git
Outstanding English both verbal and written
Experience in the field of anti-financial crime or banking is a plus

Git

Python

Flexible engagement models.

Customized IT and software development solutions.
A supportive and collaborative work environment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We‚Äôre seeking a versatile and hands-on Data Scientist to join our analytics team and help drive performance across the entire game lifecycle‚Äîfrom user acquisition to in-game engagement and monetization. You'll work on a wide range of analytics and modeling challenges, including player behavior analysis, LTV prediction, retention modeling, matchmaking evaluation, and economy balancing.

This is a role with a strong analytical foundation and practical application‚Äîideal for someone excited to impact both gameplay and growth strategy through data.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You‚Äôll build and refine LTV and ROAS prediction models to support both marketing and product monetization strategies.
You‚Äôll analyze player behavior to uncover churn patterns, engagement drivers, and opportunities for personalization.
You‚Äôll collaborate with game designers and product teams to evaluate progression systems, level difficulty, and matchmaking balance.
You‚Äôll design and analyze A/B tests for new features, events, or offers to improve player retention and satisfaction.
You‚Äôll build and maintain data models and pipelines (e.g., using SQL, dbt) to support both game and growth analytics.
You‚Äôll create dashboards and automated reports that surface key insights across game health, economy, and acquisition.
You‚Äôll work with marketing teams on attribution (e.g., SKAN) and campaign analysis when needed.
You‚Äôll proactively propose and drive data science initiatives that improve player experience or business performance.


What You'll Bring To The Team


At least 4 years of experience in data science or analytics (gaming, mobile apps, or tech).
Strong analytical foundation, ideally with a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL and Python (or R), and proven experience with predictive modeling (e.g., regression, classification, clustering).
Solid understanding of statistical methods and experimental design (A/B testing, causal inference, etc.).
Familiarity with key game metrics (e.g., DAU, retention, monetization KPIs) and marketing metrics (e.g., LTV, CAC, ROAS).
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Comfort working with BI tools like Tableau, Looker, or Metabase.
Interest and experience working with LLMs or other generative AI tools, and a passion for exploring how AI can be used to accelerate analytics workflows, insights, or player-facing features.
A proactive and dependable approach, with a track record of taking initiative and following through.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with a service-oriented mindset and willingness to support teammates directly.
A positive, well-organized work style, focused on team success and delivering high-quality outcomes.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
FREELANCE AI Integration Engineer




Location: Brussels (Hybrid)

Contract: Freelance

Client: Leading Insurance Company

Duration: Until 31 December 2025




Position Overview

We are seeking an experienced AI Integration Engineer to join a leading insurance company in Brussels on a freelance basis. In this hybrid role, you will be responsible for the deployment and integration of AI chatbot services into complex insurance systems. This includes managing the infrastructure, automation workflows, and security of both development and production environments. You will play a critical role in ensuring the reliable delivery of GenAI-powered services that support life and pension insurance agents.




Key Responsibilities

API Engineering & System Integration
Design and implement secure APIs for seamless communication between GenAI services and insurance back-end platforms. Develop event-driven microservices to expose AI capabilities efficiently.
Cloud Deployment & DevOps Automation
Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines for regular updates of machine learning models and chatbot deployments. Automate infrastructure deployments using AKS (Azure Kubernetes Service) and container technologies.
Infrastructure Security & System Monitoring
Implement security best practices, including OAuth 2.0, Zero Trust principles, and rate limiting. Create monitoring tools to track infrastructure reliability and chatbot system performance.




Technical Skills & Tools

Cloud & Infrastructure: AKS, Azure API Gateway, Docker
Backend Development: FastAPI, Node.js
DevOps: Azure DevOps Pipelines




Preferred Certifications

AZ-400: Microsoft Certified: Azure DevOps Engineer Expert
AZ-305: Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Description:
Develop novel cell embeddings that integrate multi-omics foundation models‚Äî transcriptomics, proteomics, epigenomics, and metabolomics‚Äîto capture comprehensive cellular signatures. Your work will enable precise predictions of drug effects, driving innovation in drug discovery.




Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Model Development: Design deep learning models integrating diverse omics data to create robust cell embeddings for digital twin technology.

‚Ä¢ Multi-Omics Integration: Develop and refine foundation models across omics platforms into a unified cell representation.

‚Ä¢ Collaboration: Work with experts in bioinformatics, drug discovery, and AI to validate models and integrate multi-modal data.

‚Ä¢ Client & Partner Engagement: Support product and service teams in translating AI models into real-world drug discovery applications.

‚Ä¢ Research Leadership: Stay at the forefront of AI and omics advancements, contributing to scientific publications and innovation.




Preferred Qualifications:

1. PhD/Postdoc in Computer Science (or related fields): Publications in top ML conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR).

2. Strong ML/Applied Math Background: Expertise in advanced ML techniques.

3. Deep Learning Experience: Building and scaling AI models for omics or high dimensional biological data.

4. Multi-Omics Integration: Experience developing foundation models across omics datasets.

5. Collaborative Mindset: Track record of success in interdisciplinary teams and cross-functional projects.
