Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Data Scientist intern for a 3-months internship.




You will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products and services. Your primary focus will be in applying data analytics techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building data driven algorithms together with the team.

You will be directly mentored by an experienced data scientist, while working closely with the full team and reporting weekly to the CTO, CPO and CEO of the company.







Ideal start date: Flexible, after May 2025, preferably until September.




Ideal duration of internship: 3 months.




Your Responsibilities will include:

Digging into large amounts of mobile apps data to transform it into valuable market insights.
Applying data analytic techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building data driven algorithms.
Presenting results in a clear manner to different audiences.
Define the scope of opportunities and limitations of what the data enables by understanding its value for customers.




What you will learn:

A deep understanding of the technical infrastructure of a SaaS.
Experience the challenges and the day-to-day operations of a data science team within a scale-up.
Scope data driven analysis with colleagues from different backgrounds.
A strong boost in your programming and computer engineering skills.
Hands-on experience working with SQL databases and REST APIs.
Exposure to existing projects led by our data science team.
Guidance and mentorship from experienced professionals in the data science field.




Requirements:




Scientific, Statistical, or Computer Science background.
Good communication and presentation skills in English.
Basic knowledge of Python programming.
Skills in statistics and Data Sciences techniques.
Willingness to take full ownership of your project, while working close to the team
Internship agreement provided by your institution.
Availability for at least 3 months







What You Can Expect:

At AppTweak, we believe in providing our interns with hands-on experience and exposure to real-world challenges. As a Data Science Intern, you can expect:

Joining a Dynamic Team: You'll become an integral part of our Data Science team, working alongside experienced professionals who are passionate about their craft.
Startup and Scale-Up Insight: Gain firsthand experience in a multi-cultural startup/scale-up environment. Understand how projects are conceptualized, developed, and executed in a dynamic, fast-paced organization. With many multilingual employees and 5 offices around the world, you can expect to hone your English communication skills.
Technical Exposure: Learn about the technical infrastructure of a SaaS company, including key concepts like SQL and RESTful API. Develop practical skills that will set you apart in the industry.
Client-Centric Approach: Understand and adapt to the needs of our clients as you collaborate with our team to design and implement a new product feature. Witness how client feedback shapes our product development process.
Hands-On Project: Your primary goal during this internship will be to design and implement a pipeline for a new feature, providing you with a real-world project to add to your portfolio.




Why Choose AppTweak?

A supportive and collaborative work environment
Opportunities for skill development and career growth
Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and industry trends
Mentorship from experienced professionals




At Apptweak, we are committed to providing our interns with a valuable learning experience. We believe in a hands-on approach to learning and we value a working environment that supports each person‚Äôs development.

See more about our values and our team.

If you're a proactive, curious, and ambitious individual with a passion for data and technology, we want to hear from you. Join us at Apptweak and help us shape the future of mobile app optimization.

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please send us your resume and a brief paragraph explaining your interest in this position. We look forward to hearing from you!




About AppTweak




AppTweak is the trusted App Store Marketing & Intelligence Platform for mobile leaders worldwide; we provide innovative solutions that help apps and games optimize their App Store presence and increase downloads. For 10+ years, companies including Uber, Adobe, and Zynga have trusted our unique metrics, actionable insights, and expertise to make informed decisions and achieve long-term success in the competitive mobile market.




Driven by data science and a human-centered approach, AppTweak is recognized for its innovative features and rapid growth. We have been awarded ‚ÄúASO Tool of the Year‚Äù and ‚ÄúApp Data Platform of the Year‚Äù by the App Growth Awards, and have been four times recognized as one of the fastest-growing technology companies by Deloitte Belgium.




Today we are a team of +115 people based in 7 offices around the globe (Brussels, San Francisco, Bengaluru, Tokyo, Seoul, London and Beijing) supporting more than +2,000 customers worldwide, including Uber, Adobe, and Zynga, etc. We‚Äôre gearing up for fast growth and are looking for ambitious individuals to join our team!

  • Client-Centric Approach: Understand and adapt to the needs of our clients as you collaborate with our team to design and implement a new product feature. Witness how client feedback shapes our product development process.
  • Hands-On Project: Your primary goal during this internship will be to design and implement a pipeline for a new feature, providing you with a real-world project to add to your portfolio.


Why Choose AppTweak?

  • A supportive and collaborative work environment
  • Opportunities for skill development and career growth
  • Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and industry trends
  • Mentorship from experienced professionals


At Apptweak, we are committed to providing our interns with a valuable learning experience. We believe in a hands-on approach to learning and we value a working environment that supports each person‚Äôs development.

See more about our values and our team.

If you're a proactive, curious, and ambitious individual with a passion for data and technology, we want to hear from you. Join us at Apptweak and help us shape the future of mobile app optimization.

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please send us your resume and a brief paragraph explaining your interest in this position. We look forward to hearing from you!


About AppTweak


AppTweak is the trusted App Store Marketing & Intelligence Platform for mobile leaders worldwide; we provide innovative solutions that help apps and games optimize their App Store presence and increase downloads. For 10+ years, companies including Uber, Adobe, and Zynga have trusted our unique metrics, actionable insights, and expertise to make informed decisions and achieve long-term success in the competitive mobile market.


Driven by data science and a human-centered approach, AppTweak is recognized for its innovative features and rapid growth. We have been awarded ‚ÄúASO Tool of the Year‚Äù and ‚ÄúApp Data Platform of the Year‚Äù by the App Growth Awards, and have been four times recognized as one of the fastest-growing technology companies by Deloitte Belgium.


Today we are a team of +115 people based in 7 offices around the globe (Brussels, San Francisco, Bengaluru, Tokyo, Seoul, London and Beijing) supporting more than +2,000 customers worldwide, including Uber, Adobe, and Zynga, etc. We‚Äôre gearing up for fast growth and are looking for ambitious individuals to join our team!

Title: Expert in AI /NLP/ ML
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an Expert in AI /NLP/ ML fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Tasks:

  • Design and implementation of AI solutions in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead;
  • Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;
  • Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;
  • Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions;
  • Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management.



Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with 7 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience and expertise in the command of Python, R , MongoDB, C++, Matlab, Atlassian with specific hands-on experience linked to relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow);
  • Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal) and recent handson experience on using LangChain framework, Hugging Face (in NLP context), hybridsearch and streamlit;
  • Minimum 1 year of experience of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing;
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;
  • Proven experience with Deep Learning models, NLP techniques, NLTK;
  • Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models;
  • Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language, and a good understanding of French and/or German.



Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18550/04/25).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading European Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, age, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.


EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We are Remobi - We empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high performing, high quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist

Duration: Until the end of September 2025 (With the possibility of being extended)

Position Type: Freelance/Contract/B2B

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain machine learning models, including but not limited to, predictive models, natural language processing models, and computer vision models.
Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning solutions.
Develop algorithms and statistical models to optimize machine learning models and improve their accuracy.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advances in machine learning and data science.

Expected Skills & Capabilities

Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and neural networks.
Understanding and experience with AWS SageMaker
Background working closely with Snowflake
Experience with cloud-based machine learning platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.
Excellent analytical skills and profound expertise in the application of statistical modeling
Demonstrate excellent programming skills in Python & SQL as well as good skills in related analytical libraries.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Extensive experience with infrastructure as a code (IAC), particularly with AWS CDK.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You‚Äôll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




üéâ What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees‚Äô career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




üíº What we‚Äôre looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master‚Äôs or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




üìç Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




üéØ Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! üéâ

Title: Data Scientist met een ‚ù§Ô∏è voor marketing
Description:
Data Scientist met een ‚ù§Ô∏è voor marketing




Wij zijn op zoek naar een Data Scientist om ons team van performance marketeers te versterken. Krijg je energie van data-analyse en het toepassen van Data Science op zakelijke vraagstukken? Wil je jouw kennis van Google Analytics 4, BigQuery, Media data tools, CRM en Marketing automation tools uitleven en verder uitdiepen? En heb je interesse om andere mensen te helpen bij het begrijpen van data en data science? Als het volgende je aanspreekt, lees dan vooral door.




Wat zou je doen




Als Data Scientist bij Ants bestaat je job uit twee luiken.




LUIK 1: Data tracking, configuratie en dashboarding:

Digital marketing tracking uitvoering: alle hedendaagse trackinguitdagingen die ermee te maken hebben (server side tracking, GA4, GA alternatives, conversion APIs, ...)
Data visualisatie & dashboarding (Looker Studio, PowerBI of andere)
Data strategy met focus op marketing: verzamelen, opslaan, beheren, analyseren en gebruiken van data, evenals processen en tools.
Data architectuur bepalen voor marketing (marketing CRM databases, marketing automation databases, ...)




LUIK 2: Product Development

Automatiseren en productiseren van processen (denk KWR, audits, enz.)
Opportuniteiten spotten in dagelijkse werking waar data en automatisatie een weerwaarde kan spelen.
Ontwikkelen en uitwerken van tools die bijdragen aan onze werking en aan de werking van onze projecten met onze klanten.




Je profiel




KENNIS

Je hebt ervaring in marketing en data-analyse
Ervaring met het beheren van databases
Google Cloud Platform en Big Query zijn voor jou geen ongekend terrein
Diepgaande kennis van SQL (GoogleSQL)
Kennis van Python of R is een pluspunt
Ervaring met marketingcampagnes en het meten van resultaten
Kennis van andere digitale marketingkanalen: je hebt een breder begrip van digitale marketingkanalen en hoe deze in combinatie met Google Ads gebruikt kunnen worden om bedrijfsdoelstellingen te bereiken. In het bijzonder ook aandacht voor Bing Ads




ATTITUDE

Sterke analytische vaardigheden en de mogelijkheid om data te vertalen naar actiegerichte inzichten.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden om campagneprestaties aan stakeholders te communiceren en aanbevelingen voor verbetering te doen.
Een innovatieve mindset. Je ziet mogelijkheden om te automatiseren, te productiseren en hoe data kan bijdragen aan dagelijkse processen.
Je bent hands-on, oplossingsgericht, zoekt graag zaken uit en werkt goed zelfstandig.




Waarom Ants?

Je werkt samen met seniors = veel bijleren en vooral de juiste dingen doen die werken.
Volledige ownership = jij bepaalt mee de analyses die we moeten doen, we luisteren naar je inzichten en voorstellen. Je kan mee vorm geven aan je planning en roadmap.
Gebeten door data = cijfers zijn steeds onze leidraad. We spreken jou taal.
Je krijgt de tijd, ondersteuning en budget om een individueel groeiplan te volgen.




Wat we aanbieden

Een aantrekkelijk loon afhankelijk van je ervaring en skillset aangevuld met:




26 dagen verlof + 1 anci√´nniteitsdag per gewerkt jaar
Maaltijdcheques √† 8 EUR/gewerkte dag
Ecocheques (250 EUR)
Hospitalisatieverzekering zonder franchise
Cafetariaplan (waaronder 4d extra verlof per jaar, bureau- en IT-materiaal, pensioensparen, ...)
Laptop (keuze tussen PC of Mac)
Tussenkomst in GSM- en internetabonnement
Opleidingsbudget
Deels van thuis uit werken
Free lunch op woensdag
Wagen afhankelijk van je senioriteit
Je kan in zowel Antwerpen als Gent werken
en nog meer zoets ...




Onze bedrijfscultuur: zacht voor mensen, hard voor resultaten.

Hands-on mentaliteit: we get stuff done en verkopen geen dure woorden.
Transparantie: we houden de klant op de hoogte van wat we precies doen en rapporteren veelvuldig.
Ondersteuning: niets zo eenzaam als in een job zitten waar je bij niemand terechtkan. We zullen je met de volle 100% ondersteunen in je eigen groei. Daar hebben we zelf een gecertificeerd business coach voor.
Zacht voor mensen, hard voor resultaten: we leggen de lat hoog en verwachten dat de kwaliteit steeds top is. En tegelijkertijd respecteren en bewaken we (ook) jouw energie- en tijdsinvestering: glijdende uren, van thuis uit werken, geen overboekte planning, extra verlof, check-in momenten, ...




Klinkt goed?

Welkom dan bij Ants, een digital marketing agency 35 m/v sterk, met kantoren in het legendarische Dok-Noord te Gent en aan het stadspark in Antwerpen-centrum. Samen met onze klanten doen wij aan performance marketing, online advertising, data & analytics en digitale strategie.

We groeien volop, en zijn op zoek naar een Data Scientist die goesting heeft om mee te groeien door kwaliteit voorop te zetten!




üéàWat zegt je buikgevoel?

We horen graag van je! Neem met een gerust hart contact op met ons en stuur je CV mee.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (Freelance) - 12 Months - Brussels




About RELYzIT Talent

At RELYzIT Talent, we specialize in connecting the top 2% of IT freelancers with global tech contracts. Our expertise in Infrastructure, Data, and Web 2/3 technologies allows us to support both freelancers and clients in achieving impactful results. Join us in our mission to drive innovation and excellence in the tech industry.




About the Role

Our client is seeking a skilled Data Scientist to contribute to the development and maintenance of a robust data platform. This freelance position offers the opportunity to work on centralizing and enhancing data streams, ensuring high-quality data delivery, and collaborating with domain experts to build a scalable data platform.




Key Responsibilities

Contribute to the organization of data in data warehouses and data
lakes.Implement quality controls and automate data flows using open standards and technol
ogies.Collaborate with domain experts, data analysts, and developers to enhance the data pla
tform.Optimize and tune databases and queries for improved perfor
mance.Analyze data streams and contribute to process optimization and platform architecture.




Technical Skills

Proven experience with automation of ETL data
flows.Strong understanding of data warehouse and data lake concepts, processes, and architectures.Proficiency in SQL (DQL, DDL, DCL, and DML).Experience in organizing data in data lakes, data warehouses, and digital asset management systems.
Experience in setting up data quality controls and monitoring within a data engineering environment.
Experience in database optimization and querytuning.
Experience with scripting languages such as Shell, Perl, and Python.

Language Proficiency




Fluency in Dutch at European CEFR level C2 is required.




Other Requirements

Remote work possible, with a minimum of 2 days per week on-site.




We invite you to upload your CV and join our network of elite IT professionals.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert will be based in Brussels, Belgium. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your Tasks:

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.



Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Python, NLP, Machine Learning;
  • Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio);
  • Excellent knowledge of Perl, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas);
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Management;
  • Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
  • Good knowledge of Linux, Unix and Bash;
  • Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies;
  • Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase;
  • Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot;
  • Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Excellent command of the English language and a good understanding of French.



Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18582/04/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading European Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, age, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.


EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: R&D Data Science internship
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Are you passionate about the science behind products? Do you want to develop innovations for the world's biggest brands? Then a technical career at P&G could be what you are looking for!

Join us for an internship and you could soon leave your mark in fields like natural sciences, materials, automation, sustainability, analytics, simulation and modelling through your project.

We are looking for R&D Data Science intern who will help Fabric & Home Care by leveraging data-driven insights through machine learning and deep learning techniques, including convolutional neural networks, to enhance product and packaging performance and innovate solutions that meet consumer needs. In this role, you will analyze consumer data and develop predictive models all while collaborating with a dynamic team.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G‚ÄôS SUCCESS:


You will get a chance to gain industrial experience and experience what working with us is like;
You will be responsible for your own project(s) from day 1 and put your technical skills to work on some of the toughest technical challenges;
You will improve your collaboration and management skills through practical experience and interactive training courses;
You get to experience the working environment in a leading international company and learn to work effectively with people of different nationalities and cultural backgrounds.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


Masters students in Software engineering, Data science, Data engineering, instead of just Software Engineering.
Students who will be enrolled at university for the full period of the internship
Demonstrated history of academic excellence at all stages through school and university education
Good command of English
Passion and ability to take initiative and make things happen
Be technically curious, creative and innovative
Have a good communication and collaboration skills
If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.


YOUR ADVANTAGES:


A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours;
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Data Scientist intern for a 3-months internship.




You will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products and services. Your primary focus will be in applying data analytics techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building data driven algorithms together with the team.

You will be directly mentored by an experienced data scientist, while working closely with the full team and reporting weekly to the CTO, CPO and CEO of the company.







Ideal start date: Flexible, after May 2025, preferably until September.




Ideal duration of internship: 3 months.




Your Responsibilities will include:

Digging into large amounts of mobile apps data to transform it into valuable market insights.
Applying data analytic techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building data driven algorithms.
Presenting results in a clear manner to different audiences.
Define the scope of opportunities and limitations of what the data enables by understanding its value for customers.




What you will learn:

A deep understanding of the technical infrastructure of a SaaS.
Experience the challenges and the day-to-day operations of a data science team within a scale-up.
Scope data driven analysis with colleagues from different backgrounds.
A strong boost in your programming and computer engineering skills.
Hands-on experience working with SQL databases and REST APIs.
Exposure to existing projects led by our data science team.
Guidance and mentorship from experienced professionals in the data science field.




Requirements:




Scientific, Statistical, or Computer Science background.
Good communication and presentation skills in English.
Basic knowledge of Python programming.
Skills in statistics and Data Sciences techniques.
Willingness to take full ownership of your project, while working close to the team
Internship agreement provided by your institution.
Availability for at least 3 months







What You Can Expect:

At AppTweak, we believe in providing our interns with hands-on experience and exposure to real-world challenges. As a Data Science Intern, you can expect:

Joining a Dynamic Team: You'll become an integral part of our Data Science team, working alongside experienced professionals who are passionate about their craft.
Startup and Scale-Up Insight: Gain firsthand experience in a multi-cultural startup/scale-up environment. Understand how projects are conceptualized, developed, and executed in a dynamic, fast-paced organization. With many multilingual employees and 5 offices around the world, you can expect to hone your English communication skills.
Technical Exposure: Learn about the technical infrastructure of a SaaS company, including key concepts like SQL and RESTful API. Develop practical skills that will set you apart in the industry.
Client-Centric Approach: Understand and adapt to the needs of our clients as you collaborate with our team to design and implement a new product feature. Witness how client feedback shapes our product development process.
Hands-On Project: Your primary goal during this internship will be to design and implement a pipeline for a new feature, providing you with a real-world project to add to your portfolio.




Why Choose AppTweak?

A supportive and collaborative work environment
Opportunities for skill development and career growth
Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and industry trends
Mentorship from experienced professionals




At Apptweak, we are committed to providing our interns with a valuable learning experience. We believe in a hands-on approach to learning and we value a working environment that supports each person‚Äôs development.

See more about our values and our team.

If you're a proactive, curious, and ambitious individual with a passion for data and technology, we want to hear from you. Join us at Apptweak and help us shape the future of mobile app optimization.

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please send us your resume and a brief paragraph explaining your interest in this position. We look forward to hearing from you!




About AppTweak




AppTweak is the trusted App Store Marketing & Intelligence Platform for mobile leaders worldwide; we provide innovative solutions that help apps and games optimize their App Store presence and increase downloads. For 10+ years, companies including Uber, Adobe, and Zynga have trusted our unique metrics, actionable insights, and expertise to make informed decisions and achieve long-term success in the competitive mobile market.




Driven by data science and a human-centered approach, AppTweak is recognized for its innovative features and rapid growth. We have been awarded ‚ÄúASO Tool of the Year‚Äù and ‚ÄúApp Data Platform of the Year‚Äù by the App Growth Awards, and have been four times recognized as one of the fastest-growing technology companies by Deloitte Belgium.




Today we are a team of +115 people based in 7 offices around the globe (Brussels, San Francisco, Bengaluru, Tokyo, Seoul, London and Beijing) supporting more than +2,000 customers worldwide, including Uber, Adobe, and Zynga, etc. We‚Äôre gearing up for fast growth and are looking for ambitious individuals to join our team!

Title: Data Science Specialist - OptimusAI (Manufacturing / Industry)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will be based in our Brussels office as part of McKinsey‚Äôs manufacturing AI solution (OptimusAI), which sits at the intersection of three practices

Global Energy and Materials advises production and investor companies across chemicals & agriculture, paper & packaging, metals & mining, oil & gas, and power generation on strategic, operational, and growth issues.

QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey the AI arm of our firm which helps clients transform faster, innovate smart, and anticipate the future.

Operations assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges by developing and implementing operational strategies, initiatives and solutions for their most critical problems. Connecting boardroom strategies to the shopfloor operators.

At the intersection of these groups, OptimusAI is a team of ~10 expert consultants, data scientists and engineers, focused on improving processing plant productivity through data analytics.

We develop real-time AI advisory systems to support decision making in the plant control room, we assess and optimize process control systems, and we unlock plant bottlenecks through data-driven process changes.

OptimusAI supports a global community of consultants by developing an innovative machine learning toolkit and codifying the approach to deliver significant and lasting client impact.

Your Impact

Are you passionate about leveraging analytics to drive real-world impact? As an OptimusAI Data Science Specialist, you will help leading companies across the Energy and Materials sector unlock their full productivity potential using AI.

Collaborating in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team of 3-6 experts, you will use your creativity and analytics expertise to enhance client performance in areas such as energy efficiency, product quality, and capacity. You will be working side-by-side with the client‚Äôs process engineers and analytics specialists and will be communicating your work to executive audiences.

Internally, you will collaborate with our talented product engineers to develop innovative products and algorithms to address current and future client needs. You will help codify best practices, radiate our impact in/externally and shape the product roadmap.

Along the way, you will benefit from world-class training in business problem structuring and client advisory, while working closely with senior manufacturing and analytics experts. Experience unparalleled career growth with significant ownership and responsibility from day one, all within a collaborative, diverse, and non-hierarchical environment. Seize the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world.

Ready to deliver direct impact on some of the world's largest industrial players? We invite you to submit a cover letter detailing why you are the perfect fit for our team and how you can contribute to our mission!

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a discipline such as Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Machine Learning or equivalent
4+ years of relevant professional experience in advanced analytics, ideally in the context of heavy industry
Ability to write clean and efficient code in Python; ideally with experience in using cloud computing resources (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure)
Ability to apply and advise on state-of-the-art analytics, machine learning, and optimization techniques to derive business insights and solve complex problems
Excellent problem-solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and effective solutions
Ability to thrive in a flexible, multi-disciplinary and agile working environment
Strong interpersonal communication skills; experience in facilitating discussions with leadership
Track record of completing projects successfully on time as per scope
Willingness to travel to other offices and/or client locations for short/long term assignments

Title: Senior Data Scientist - McKinsey Transformation
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will work in our McKinsey Transformation Client Capabilities Network in EMEA and will be part of our Wave Transformatics team.

Wave is a McKinsey SaaS product that equips clients to successfully manage improvement programs and transformations. Focused on business impact, Wave allows clients to track the impact of individual initiatives and understand how they affect longer term goals. It is a mix of an intuitive interface and McKinsey business expertise that gives clients a simple and insightful picture of what can otherwise be a complex process by allowing them to track the progress and performance of initiatives against business goals, budget and time frames.

Our Transformatics team builds data and AI products to provide analytics insights to clients and McKinsey teams involved in transformation programs across the globe. The current team is composed of data engineers, data scientists and product managers who are spread across several geographies. The team covers a variety of industries, functions, analytics methodologies and platforms ‚Äì e.g. Cloud data engineering, advanced statistics, machine learning, predictive analytics, MLOps and generative AI.

Your Impact

You will collaborate closely with a team comprising data scientists, data engineers, product developers, and analytics-focused consultants.

You will work on topics such as descriptive analytics, predictive models (e.g., boosted trees), and large language models (LLMs), particularly for segmentation use cases. Additionally, you will design and deliver products that adhere to MLOps best practices, ensuring they are both maintainable and deployable. By doing so, you will help bring advanced analytics capabilities into one of McKinsey‚Äôs flagship products, named "Wave". Your work will be the backbone for how McKinsey runs future Transformations, leveraging data science assets, to improve the odds of success for our clients.

In this role, you will be responsible for the following, as the primary focus


Advanced insight generation transforming complex business questions into statically relevant analyses and these analyses into easy to digest insights. Delivering this through well documented and tested pipelines, that allow easy collaboration with other team members.
Upholding technical excellence Together with the tech lead(s) define how to build, maintain and scale our pipelines. Often piloting new technical approaches & automation. Using your business understanding to critically review model results, trends, analyses and classifications.
Coach & help other colleagues Coach & help you peers when needed, we deliver as a team.
Machine learning model development Lead the design and refinement of statistical models, optimization techniques, advanced machine learning, and predictive models
LLM optimization and evaluation Fine-tune and evaluating the performance and efficiency of Large Language Models, leveraging the latest advancements in neural network architectures and machine learning techniques


Your role might also include, as the secondary focus


Design & build creative approaches to further optimize accuracy & reduce cost In addition to optimizing the LLM through prompts and settings, you will design and test alternative approaches, such as pre-filters and non-LLM-based text models, within parallel multi-agent setups.
Build for scale Together with the tech lead(s), you will define how to maintain and scale our LLM classifier pipeline. The classifier pipeline will, in the long term, run as a on-demand batch process, and will, once stable, be refactored with scalability in mind.
Deploying pipelines at scale Although not core to your role, you will be exposed to cloud deployments & orchestration of our pipelines and can shape these if you have an interest in this field.
Expert guidance for client teams You will work closely with global client service teams to deliver high-quality advanced analytics solutions, offering expert guidance to ensure analytical excellence and understanding at client teams.
Knowledge and research You will contribute to influential articles, white papers, and research, positioning the firm as a thought leader in analytics and transformation, with a focus on LLMs and predictive modeling


Your Qualifications and Skills


Familiarity with neural network architectures (Transformers), RAG models, deep learning libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch) and machine learning libraries (scikit-learn) is a plus
Exposure to extra tooling such as Snowflake, Excel and Tableau is a plus
Experience in leading complex engagements to deploy advanced analytics and data science methods at scale in real world organizations
Programming experience in the following languages Python and SQL‚ÄØ
3+ years of relevant experience with classical descriptive statistics, standard statistical modelling (e.g. advanced regressions, clustering, classification models) and machine learning techniques (e.g. random forest, support vector machines, gradient boosting, XGBoost)‚ÄØ
Strong data translation and presentation skills with the ability to clearly and effectively communicate complex analytical and technical content
MSc or PhD level in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics or equivalent by experience

It is a mix of an intuitive interface and McKinsey business expertise that gives clients a simple and insightful picture of what can otherwise be a complex process by allowing them to track the progress and performance of initiatives against business goals, budget and time frames.

Title: Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.




At Exsolv√¶, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.




Your Role:

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.




Preferred Skills

Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.




What You‚Äôll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.




Technical Implementation

Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.




Project Management

Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (Freelance) - 12 Months - Brussels




About RELYzIT Talent

At RELYzIT Talent, we specialize in connecting the top 2% of IT freelancers with global tech contracts. Our expertise in Infrastructure, Data, and Web 2/3 technologies allows us to support both freelancers and clients in achieving impactful results. Join us in our mission to drive innovation and excellence in the tech industry.




About the Role

Our client is seeking a skilled Data Scientist to contribute to the development and maintenance of a robust data platform. This freelance position offers the opportunity to work on centralizing and enhancing data streams, ensuring high-quality data delivery, and collaborating with domain experts to build a scalable data platform.




Key Responsibilities

Contribute to the organization of data in data warehouses and data
lakes.Implement quality controls and automate data flows using open standards and technol
ogies.Collaborate with domain experts, data analysts, and developers to enhance the data pla
tform.Optimize and tune databases and queries for improved perfor
mance.Analyze data streams and contribute to process optimization and platform architecture.




Technical Skills

flows.Strong understanding of data warehouse and data lake concepts, processes, and architectures.Proficiency in SQL (DQL, DDL, DCL, and DML).Experience in organizing data in data lakes, data warehouses, and digital asset management systems.

Title: AI Engineering Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and a desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to develop a platform for AI?

Then join P&G as an AI Engineering intern. Through your internship you will build your AI Engineering skills to help P&G's business processes to leverage AI.

The space of Image Segmentation is developing fast - what are the criteria for using "classic" vision (such as YOLO) versus GenAI versus few-shot segmentation?

Leveraging P&G's AI platform, how do you bring this to end-users / citizen developers?

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G‚ÄôS SUCCESS:

  • Partner with data scientists, product managers, infrastructure engineers and peer AI Engineers to design, develop, operationalize, integrate, and scale new algorithmic products including Generative AI models;
  • Build enterprise AI platforms and accelerators to enable deployment of applications with AI core and access AI models via APIs or batch pipelines;
  • Develop high quality, standard-compliant and tested code. Contribute code to shared libraries;
  • Implement DevOps methodologies, DataOps and MLOps principles in day-to-day work;
  • Develop continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines;
  • Continuously evaluate in proof of concepts, recommend best technologies and ML models.

Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:

  • Pursuing a Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field;
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Python;
  • Basic knowledge of machine learning, image segmentation is a plus;
  • Strong analytical skills and a passion for problem-solving;
  • A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn new technologies and methodologies.

YOUR ADVANTAGES:

  • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
  • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
  • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
  • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
  • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
  • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
  • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
  • Subsidized company restaurant;
  • On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
  • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
  • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
  • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
  • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

  • We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

Title: Solver - Generative AI Specialist
Description:
About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation, providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services tailored to empower its partners and address their unique challenges. We tackle complex challenges with a holistic approach, fostering collaboration across diverse expertise areas, including Data Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Governance.




Our "Solvers" are passionate professionals empowered by cutting-edge tools, a culture of knowledge sharing, and continuous learning opportunities. We are seeking a Generative AI Specialist to join our team of experts, helping our clients leverage the power of advanced AI technologies to transform their operations.




Your Role:

As a Generative AI Specialist, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative AI solutions, with a particular focus on generative models and their applications.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications (Mandatory)

Educational Background: Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience including at least 2 in the aforementioned specialty
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Skills

Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.




What You‚Äôll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Collaboration: Engage with clients to identify business needs, explore AI opportunities, and deliver tailored solutions leveraging generative AI.
Use Case Development: Analyze client challenges to propose and implement generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, content creation, or workflow automation.




Technical Implementation

Model Development: Design, build, and fine-tune generative AI models using frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, and Hugging Face.
Agent Design: Create agent-based architectures for real-time decision-making and task automation.
Integration: Connect generative AI systems with external tools, APIs, and enterprise systems to optimize workflow and performance.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and contribute to internal R&D initiatives.
Experiment with emerging models, techniques, and tools to ensure cutting-edge solutions for clients.




Project Management

Plan, execute, and oversee the delivery of AI projects, ensuring timely and high-quality outcomes.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Your Role:

As a Generative AI Specialist, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative AI solutions, with a particular focus on generative models and their applications.


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


Required Skills and Qualifications (Mandatory)

  • Educational Background: Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
  • Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience including at least 2 in the aforementioned specialty
  • Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
  • Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
  • Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
  • Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Skills

  • Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
  • Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
  • Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
  • Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.


What You‚Äôll Do:


Core Expertise

  • Client Collaboration: Engage with clients to identify business needs, explore AI opportunities, and deliver tailored solutions leveraging generative AI.
  • Use Case Development: Analyze client challenges to propose and implement generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, content creation, or workflow automation.


Technical Implementation

  • Model Development: Design, build, and fine-tune generative AI models using frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, and Hugging Face.
  • Agent Design: Create agent-based architectures for real-time decision-making and task automation.
  • Integration: Connect generative AI systems with external tools, APIs, and enterprise systems to optimize workflow and performance.


Research and Innovation

  • Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and contribute to internal R&D initiatives.
  • Experiment with emerging models, techniques, and tools to ensure cutting-edge solutions for clients.


Project Management

  • Plan, execute, and oversee the delivery of AI projects, ensuring timely and high-quality outcomes.
  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.


Training and Support

  • Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
  • Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.


Why Join Us?

  • Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
  • Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
  • Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
  • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
  • Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Title: Research Scientist/Engineer
Description:
APPLICATION BY EMAIL according to the application rules hereunder (not via LinkedIn). Please attach all the documents asked.




CONTEXT

The Royal Military Academy is fully recognized as a university, fulfilling the same criteria as civilian universities. The RMA is also conducting scientific research at university level for projects funded by the Belgian Defense department or external sources.

In the framework of the study SHABAM, we are looking for a full-time researcher in digital communications with a Bachelors/Master degree in Telecommunication Engineer (MSc), or equivalent, with firm background on Signal and Systems theory, digital communications and electronics.

We value diversity and equal opportunities. Whether you are a man, a woman or X, or come from any background, we firmly believe that diversity enriches our community, and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.




PROJECT:

You work within the department of CISS of the Faculty of Polytechnic of the RMA and in close collaboration with researcher, scientists and engineers from the other consortium partners. You conduct scientific research at university level on a project entitled ‚ÄòSHABAM‚Äô.

The EDA ad hoc project type B called SHABAM for ‚ÄúSHAring BAndwidth in Military systems‚Äù will investigate the capability of DSM concepts to allow efficient spectrum usage between radio systems in an operation theatre that may consist of several nations operating on several co-operative or non-co-operative waveforms. Another challenge will be to provide robust improvements to the super high fidelity simulator to accommodate the new objectives, such as adding new UHF and VHF basic waveforms. The consortium is composed of 10 prime contractors, representing 5 different countries (BE, FI, FR, GE, NO). The Consortium Coordinator is Thales SIX from France.




MAIN TASKS:

Adding a second VHF waveform using bandwidth scaling. The N1 mode of the NBWF offers only a limited transmission capacity. A higher bit rate, by compromising some range, will render NBWF more interesting for bridging IP communication or control traffic, supporting UHF waveform, etc
Control of WF frequency hopping sequences : the idea is to control the VHF/UHF frequency hopping sequences of the communication networks for the coexistence of heterogeneous waveforms using Local DSM with cross-waveform signaling
VHF rate adaption : Having the possibility to use multiple bit rates within the same VHF network will add flexibility in dynamic environments where link characteristics change over time. To be able to handle multiple bit rates in the same VHF network, a link adaptation mechanism is needed at the link layer.







SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Degree(s) required: Master degree in Telecommunication Engineer (MSc), or equivalent, with firm background on Signal and Systems theory, digital communications and electronics.

This position is open for experienced profiles (ideally 3 years of experience minimum).




‚ÄúMUST HAVE‚Äù skills :

Good experience in SDR/digital communications : modulation schemes, error correction coding, characterization of communication links (channel distortion, BER, FER)
Good experience in digital signal processing : digital filtering, digital modulation/demodulation, coding/decoding, interference mitigation etc.
Software Programming : MATLAB, C/C++ , Python.




‚ÄúNICE TO HAVE‚Äù skills :

Knowledge of Dynamic Spectrum Management
Knowledge of Routing Algorithms (e.g. OLSR)
Knowledge of Neural Networks, Artificial Intelligence.




Personal skills :

You conduct scientific research in an independent and upright way within a multidisciplinary environment.
You think in an innovative and creative way.
You communicate your results in a clear, concise and precise manner.
You solve problems autonomously and find alternatives or solutions.




Other skills:

The applicant shall have good knowledge of English (oral / written).
Minimum knowledge of French or Dutch is an added value for collaboration with peers.




SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS

The researcher may be exposed to classified information and will therefore have to obtain the required security clearance. The candidate must consent with the background check required to obtain this clearance, which will be executed by Belgian Defense.
Only applicants with a nationality of a country that is both part of NATO and the EU will be eligible.
Working for the Patrimony requires living in Belgium for the duration of the study.




APPLICATION

Please send by email:

a CV
a scan of your ID card (both sides)

to Dr. Ir. Le Nir Vincent (vincent.lenir@mil.be ) / Prof. Dr. Ir. Mathias Becquaert (mathias.becquaert@mil.be ) and to erm-deao-rswo@mil.be

Please mention clearly the reference of the project: ‚ÄúSHABAM‚Äù.

Application deadline: 04/05/2025.

The interviews will take place at the Royal Military Academy, Hobbemastraat 8, 1000 Brussels. If needed, on-line interviews can be organized. The date and time of the interview will be communicated to the preselected candidates.




CONTRACT

Probable date of recruitment: from 01/06/2025, in consultation with the applicant.
Status: Full-time employment (38 hours / week) based on an open-ended contract with the Patrimony of the Royal Military Academy (you will not be a civil servant).
Please note that your contract will be open-ended, but the financing of the contract will be tied to the funding project, which is guaranteed for 3 years. There is a high chance for the project to be prolonged after this initial period, depending on the availability of new funding.
Wage scale: class A1 (holder of a Master's degree in Science or equivalent), class A2 (holder of an Ir degree or equivalent Master's in Engineering Sciences, doctor‚Äôs degree in the same area of expertise). RMA-Patrimony applies a merit-based research career track, allowing researchers to advance in wage scale based upon annual evaluations.
Holiday pay.




EXTRA LEGAL BENEFITS

Possibility to benefit from a bilingualism allowance (Dutch/French) following a SELOR test;
End-of-year bonus;
Free DKV hospitalization insurance. Possibility of additional affiliation for one or more persons living under the same roof: spouse, child(ren) (50% of the price per additional member);
Bike allowance / Free public transport (home-work commute);
Meal vouchers (6‚Ç¨ / day);
Free access to campus sports facilities outside working hours;
On-campus restaurant and cafeteria with democratic prices (discount on the daily menu);
Flexible working hours within the 38-hour week;
Teleworking possible with allowance (2 days / week max);
Holidays:
29 days holiday / year from the 1st year of contract (then from 45 years: +1 day holiday every 5 years)
1 week OFF every year between Christmas and New year‚Äôs Eve (independent of the annual balance of holidays).
Advantages and interesting offers thanks to the Benefits@work card (discounts, vouchers...);
Entitlement to services offered by the ‚ÄòOffice Central d'Action Sociale et Culturelle de la D√©fense‚Äô (OCASC): among others holiday centres, discount on travel organised by the tour operator...;
Possibility to benefit from the nursery funded by Belgian Defence (subject to availability).




WORKPLACE

Royal Military Academy, Avenue de la Renaissance 30, 1000 Brussels. Occasional travels abroad for scientific conferences, etc.
